results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!

results.name: A Course in Miracles ongoing classes

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?


We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON NYC

results.description:
Super excited for next week's CAH Meetup, where we'll be handing over hosting duties to the Uncalled Four! -- Denver's critically acclaimed comedy game show. 

The group is in town this week for their show at the The People's Improv Theater (PIT) on 11/17


Come hang with us the night before the big show where prizes include:
The Worst Card Game (a CAH expansion pack), tickets to their big show at the PIT, and a $25 gift certificate for 1st place! 

Team registration (free) will close at 8:30pm. Come solo or bring your friends! 

HAPPY HOUR PRICING ALL NIGHT LONG!

Gramercy Ale House 272 3rd Ave. 

http://gramercyalehouse.com/

------

About the 11/17 show @ the PIT:

Denver's critically acclaimed comedy game show, Uncalled Four is hitting NYC for one night only. A mashup of CAH and Price is Right, this highly offensive show features 4 comedians  (Josh Gondelman, John Early, Nick Vatterott, and one mystery guest!)  competing for the title of "NYC's Worst Person". The comedians have written their own cards (which are decidedly far worse than anything you've seen in CAH) and the audience asks the questions. 


Sign-up begins at 8:30pm. Tickets for the Tuesday event are $5. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/1615104628757272/

The Uncalled Four crew will be hosting their bar game version of CAH where teams will compete for $$$PRIZES$$$. Using the cards created by comedians during the live show, teams will answer questions and judge one another until we have a winner. A unique "trivia-like" spin on your usual CAH game. 


TRAILER VIDEO

results.description:
Please take note of the change in date!  This group will be meeting temporarily on the *third* Monday of the month for the rest of 2015.  We hope the schedule will resume to the second Monday of the month in 2016.


This group meets on the second Monday of each month to discuss a specific mystery, horror, or intrigue novel. Join Moderator Aurelia Long as we discuss this month's featured selection, Frankenstein, by Mary Shelley.

Frankenstein, by Mary Shelley

Description:  Frankenstein tells the story of committed science student Victor Frankenstein. Obsessed with discovering the cause of generation and life and bestowing animation upon lifeless matter, Frankenstein assembles a human being from stolen body parts but; upon bringing it to life, he recoils in horror at the creature's hideousness. Tormented by isolation and loneliness, the once-innocent creature turns to evil and unleashes a campaign of murderous revenge against his creator, Frankenstein.  A monster assembled by a scientist from parts of dead bodies develops a mind of his own as he learns to loathe himself and hate his creator
results.name: Suspense Central:  Frankenstein by Mary Shelley - PLEASE NOTE DATE CHANGE

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!
results.name: IF BUSINESS IS PASSING YOU BY, YOU SHOULD COME TO OUR BNI

results.description:
Come once, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. It is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally. We are BNI-affilliated, and value the philosophy of "Givers Gain". We are committed to help one-another succeed. Somewhat like having a part-time sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team. If you will. "If I help you, you'll want to help me, and we'll both benefit".

RSVP now and come promote your business at an upcoming Tuesday morning meeting!
results.name: Networking meeting

group.name: BNI Genesis - Scarsdale Business Networking Meetup

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.
results.how_to_find_us: www.partnersinbusinessnj.com
results.name: Partners in Business: North Jersey Referrals Group Weekly Meetup

Come seize the day with us over a cup of coffee, a danish, and Japanese conversation at our early morning events! 

These casual gatherings are open for all levels of Japanese. We'll chat about a wide range of topics, from talking about daily life, to comparing our different cultures, and sharing tips we've learned while studying foreign languages.

！！！　Please RSVP　！！！

(Don't worry if RSVP's are low--we have members coming every day, so someone will always be there to meet you!)


Please check out our FACEBOOK page for event info and fun photos!

We look forward to meeting you soon!

J-KURU

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.
results.name: BNI Grand Central CHAPTER 51 Tuesday Mornings

results.description:
Eddie - one of our longest-standing members - is organizing a new Tuesday morning pick-up...

He'll have square goals, one of my EPL balls, and a handsome set of bibs.

Please abide by the usual RSVP rules for Tuesday's matches:

Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Tuesday Morning Pick-Up

results.description: Visit the (co)working space, grab some coffee & a donut, and chat with current members to see why we like to work here. Unsure if coworking is for you? This is a great time to find out! For two hours, take a tour, grab a desk, get some work done and find out why coworking is the only way to work these days. Check out our site for more info at www.coworkinginjersey.com. Need a conference room for meetings on occasion? We have that too! Stop in at our Open House and we'll give you a tour.
results.name: Open House

results.description:
Join other breastfeeding moms in a casual and relaxed setting to ask your most pressing breastfeeding questions like:


* How do I know if my baby is getting enough?
* Is my latch correct?
* Why does it hurt my left breast and not my right?
* Will my nipples ever feel the same again?

This 1-1/2 hour weekly support group will be run by International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC) Elina Arulraj.

Elina is a MSPT, IBCLC has been an International Board Certified Lactation Consultant since 2009 and has been empowering moms and helping babies breastfeed since 2009. Prior to that she worked at Mount Sinai Medical Center’s lactation support groups and Labor and Delivery, and NICU units alongside three International Board Certified Lactation Consultants who had over 30 years of experience.

Drop-in. Babies welcome.

Cost is $25
results.name: Weekly Breastfeeding Support Group

results.description:
The African Union Expo LLC, and The Go Africa Network Inc. are proud to present the first African Union Expo event to be held in NYC Harlem.
The objective is to highlight and reinforce the economic, political and social ties between the African Union Member countries inclusive of region 6 (The Caribbean) and the United States of America. The Expo will bring together businessmen and political leaders from across Africa and the United States to exchange views and news on promoting trade and investment opportunities across a range of targeted range of sectors between the Africa and the U.S.

It is an opportunity for government entities and companies of all small to medium sized, To engage, interact and learn formative knowledge leading to demonstrable results and revenues in the evolving future.

There will also be a InnovateHer competition for female entrepreneurs. Free and open to the public. Check website for more info. And it's free. Check website for more info: http://africanunionexpo.org/events/african-union-expo-2015-nyc-harlem/
results.name: AFRICAN UNION INVESTMENT EXPO AT MIST

results.description:
Hello Friends,

My name is Samir Patel, Growth Mentor at 500Startups. I am offering the world's first GrowthMBA in partnership with THE NEXT WEB at the Dutch Embassy November 17, 2015, the day before TNW NYC Conference.

This mini-intensive focuses on everyone's quagmire: How to Scale a company from Traction to Hyper-Growth.

I will share strategic and tactical wisdom from having managed $1B+ in Growth dollars. My work has produced explosive Growth for these giants: 500Startup companies around the world, Salesforce.com, Accenture, Priceline, Experian, Scottrade and AT&T YellowPages. 

In the end, you will take-away a practical playbook on how to 'Build your Growth Machine', a systematic way to Architect your Growth Engine that’s Scalable, Repeatable and Predictable. Since the GrowthMBA is an exclusive workshop, I apologize in advance if you are not accepted, but we will notify you for future workshops. 

More about Growth MBA: http://bit.ly/gmbainaday

See Testimonials: http://bit.ly/gmbatestimonials

More about The Next Web Conference: http://bit.ly/tnwconf

Samir Patel
President & CEO, GrowthMachines
Growth Mentor, 500Startups
Connect with me on LinkedIn

results.description:
Webinar: 6 Essentials for Delivering Your Sales Pitch 


USE THIS EXCLUSIVE LINK TO REGISTER NOW [Required]



Engagement is the lifeblood of the modern sales process. 

Customers are highly informed and highly demanding. They expect to be able to get information on any aspect of your product whenever they need it. 

Throughout the sales cycle, you are constantly pitching with content that needs to intrigue and educate them. But how do you get the most out of what you are pitching? 

To deliver your content that engages customers and drives sales, you need 6 essentials to effective sales pitches. 

This 30-minute webinar will dive in to each of the essentials so your customers get more relevant and more engaging content you get better deal velocity and a higher conversion rate.

results.description:
** Do NOT bring any outside food to the shop.  La Casita sells refreshments & snacks. **

 

We are meeting at La Casita Yarn Store at 253 Smith St between Douglas & Degraw from 2-4pm. The Carroll Street F stop is the closest and the 57 bus stops at Douglass St.

The yarn store is small and cozy and has a cafe with yummy snacks, small meals and drinks - including wine and beer!  In order to support LaCasita, who generously hosts our weekly meeting, we ask that you buy something while attending.

As always with meetups, you'll probably want to leave your more complex projects at home...

Attendance for this meet up is limited to 10 people due to the size of the venue. Please be sure to RSVP if you plan to attend and change your RSVP if your plans change.
results.name: Tuesday Daytime Meetup @ La Casita Yarn Shop & Cafe

results.description:
In this 2-hr fashion photography class our experienced instructors will assist you in exploring composition, studio and outdoor lighting, industry trends and the use of Photoshop in fashion images. Students are encouraged to bring fashion images to be analyzed and broken down during class time. Bring your camera with fresh batteries, and it's manuals if at hand. 

Requirements: Basic knowledge of aperture & shutter-speed are highly recommended but not necessary. Note, if you are looking to learn Studio Photography only, please refer to our ""Studio & Lighting seminar""

NOTE: Please only RSVP if you are certain you can make the event. There is a limited number of seats available and each RSVP gets one. Please cancel as soon as know you cannot make it so the next person the waiting list can attend. Thank you!

See you there!

results.description:
The time has come to WRITE!

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. If you have been looking for a time and space to get busy adding words to a current project, then this meetup is for you. I will bring along my bag full of prompts if anyone wants to peruse them to get started, but, for all intents and purposes, this meetup is an opportunity to support you in whatever you need to be working on now.

We will be meeting in the events room at the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library on Victory Blvd close to CSI. They are tables and chairs for us, so bring your notebooks, journals or laptops with you to get your work done. There are outlets in the room and the library offers free wi-fi. We are permitted to have food and beverages, but they must remain in the room (they can't be brought out to the library itself). There is also a parking lot and bus stop right outside the building for your convenience!
results.name: Weekly Write-In!

results.description: I have created a platform where entrepreneurs and business professionals can gather to network in a high-spirited environment. I feel networking is more that just handing out business cards and gathering leads, but more about getting to know an individual and building a meaningful relationship.
results.name: Let's meet up to network, educate, motivate and share ideas.

results.description:
LIVE! AMMUNITION! Is Shark Tank, for filmmakers!

The New York Film Group in partnership with Raindance is pleased to host LIVE! AMMUNITION! In this competition screenwriters and filmmakers will pitch their film, TV, or web series idea in 2 minutes or less to a panel of industry insiders in front of a LIVE audience. It’s fun. It’s nerve-wracking. And you're going to learn an awful lot.

Legendary horror filmmaker and Troma films founder Lloyd Kaufman, and Raindance founder Elliot Grove will be in town to host this signature event. Bring your business cards. Bring your courage and join the pitch line up.

Bring a friend to cheer you on - or just come watch and cheer on other pitchers in this intense and emotionally charged evening.

Pitch your brilliant movie idea in ONLY TWO MINUTES! Throw a fiver into a hat - the winner takes home the cash, plus lunch with a panelist to discuss the winning project. Nerve wracking and fun. Pitch a feature, doc, TV, or web series project. 

Networking drinks afterwards with producers and industry professionals. Come and be part of the audience if you're too shy to pitch! Could lead to serious interest or an option for your script or digital project.

Confirmed Industry Panelists:

MC: Elliot Grove, founder of Raindance (confirmed)

Lloyd Kaufman, director/producer/writer, co-founder of Troma (confirmed)

Kevin Comer, exec. producer (confirmed)

John Trigonis, author Crowdfunding for Filmmakers (waiting confirmation)

Sarah Ramey, Gawker (waiting confirmation)

At the end of the evening, prizes are awarded for the best 3 pitches. The 1st prize winner gets lunch with one of the panelists courtesy of Raindance. 

Entry is $10.00

You MUST register to pitch.
You MUST register to attend.


More event details here: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/183845931956099/


See you then!

TJ Collins

Co-Founder NYFG 

NewYork Film Group


New York Film Group - Facebook
results.name: LIVE! AMMUNITION! pitch your movie idea to  producers and industry professionals

4 out of 5 people go online to find local businesses.  Do you come up in their search?  If not, we can help.

Come to our workshop where Google experts will be on hand to get your business listed on Google and Google Maps.  Whether you’re a corporation, restaurant, dentist or dry cleaner, you’ll take home invaluable tips to help your business succeed. Learn how to build a powerful presence online and network with fellow businesses.

Businesses will receive‎ $100 towards AdWords and can register for a workshop with Starfish Global to learn how to create a website using Google's site builder. Both the site and domain are free for a year. 

Marketing, legal and accounting consultants will also be there to answer any questions you may have. Both easy and free, it’s a two-hour event you can’t afford to miss (especially with the holiday season- and sales- around corner.  Free giveaways and refreshments!

Get on Google and reap the rewards.

results.description:
Reserve early and save, http://nyspin201511.eventbrite.com/?aff=nyspinmeetup

Networking starts at 5:30 pm;  Program starts at 6:15 pm 

When we hear about the benefits of Scrum, the team is often co-located. What happens when they are not? People work from home. Hurricane Sandy happens. A team member lives in another city. This presentation will address some approaches for continuing Scrum effectively with a team that isn't co-located. From how to deal with sprint planning to running an inclusive retrospective, attendees will walk away with techniques they can apply for using Scrum with virtual team members. This presentation will also cover how all team members can work more effectively with remote developers. They might even be able to improve non-Scrum meetings too.


Brief Bio's 

Jeanne Boyarsky and Janeice DelVecchio have worked together both remotely and in person on a development team at their day jobs and as volunteers on coderanch.com. This gives them exposure to both large and small projects. Jeanne also serves as a part time ScrumMaster to the team. She also wrote her first book this year (OCA: Oracle Certified Associate Java SE 8 Programmer I Study Guide).  In her free time, she enjoys watching and playing tennis. Janeice telecommutes full time. In her free time, she enjoys playing with her dog Leroy.
results.name: Jeanne Boyarsky: Virtual Scrum

results.description:
[edit] Unfortunately it looks like the RSVP's for the ableton event are full now, although they might still let people in without an RSVP at the door.  I got one, so I'm still going, hope to see some of you there that got a spot, please leave a comment on here if you got an RSVP and are going.

Hey guys, this is a meetup announcement as well as public service annoncement!  We haven’t been able to schedule a regular Sunday meetup in a little white, but there are other ways we can meet up.  First of all, be sure to join the facebook page, and I’ll try to announce other cool related events that we can meet up at, even if they aren’t events that we are running ourselves. There’s SO MUCH going on in NYC  and I feel like people are starving to find out about cool places to meet other producers. 


First of all this is our Facebook group, it’s the easiest way for people to post about upcoming events related to electronic music, producing, pro audio, parties, etc.  

</a> <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1419461328304642/"> https://www.facebook.com/groups/1419461328304642/


If you are looking to meet up with other producers in more of a live show/music maker context, you should check out Warper Party. Anyone can sign up to play, they cater toward people making live electronic music, but DJ’s and bands with an electronic element play there as well.  It’s a super fun good time and I’ve met many friends at their events.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/warperparty/?ref=br_tf


Lastly, if you guys want to meet up next week and grab a drink, we can do that before this event: 

</a> <a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/new-york-ableton-user-group-meetup-tickets-19262058335">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/new-york-ableton-user-group-meetup-tickets-19262058335

It’s an ableton live user group meetup, and I know a lot of you guys are ableton live users, so we should all meet up somewhere nearby before the event, then head over. PLEASE RSVP using the link above since this event is not affiliated with meetup.com or our group in any way.  The event is at 29 Little West 12th Street New York, NY 10014 so if anyone knows a chill, quiet, not too crowded bar nearby for us to meet up beforehand, please let me know, otherwise I’ll have to just rely on yelp for suggestions and update the location accordingly.  The Ableton event is at 7:00 so we should try to meet at a bar around 5:30 - 6:00 and then head over there around 6:45.  


P.S., if anyone is looking for private lessons in Ableton Live or FL Studio for production or playing live, I provide these services and you can contact me directly on Meetup.com, thanks.
results.name: Ableton Meetup / PSA For Members

results.description:
From perhaps the most humble of beginnings, a desperate band must survive a supernatural storm and escape from a joined force of goblin and orc slavers.

Having found another dragonborn prisoner, the survivors of the wreck encountered an ancient priest of the goddess of the abandoned temple. He told them some of the background of the island and the former king, one Viledel. While he seemed cooperative enough, his skittishness and realization that his personal items had been taken and were being worn by the survivors put him off. Storming off into the darkened temple, he left them to their own wits.

They developed a plan to lure more goblins into the abandoned temple to kill them and take their weapons. The plan worked well, though not as well as had been hoped. There were many injuries and even a death, which even Dr. Tsou's miraculous healing talent could not undo.


As they rested and thought about what to do next, a divine apparition appeared and warned them of her plans to destroy the foul creatures that had defiled her temple several days beforehand. Knowing their innocence in this, she granted her blessing to them, including restoring breath and life to their fallen friend.

With new-found purpose a plan was devised to break back into the manor house. Unfortunately, the entrance that had been used previously was now guarded by a band of orcs, which the group decided could be taken out with the bows they had just acquired from the goblins they'd slain at the temple.

The orcs moved faster than they expected and managed to close into melee, and the leader of the orcs was noted to himself be a priest of one of the ocean gods. Through skill and luck the orcs were defeated just as the final blessing of the goddess washed over them: Everyone is now 1st level.

At this time, this meetup event is closed to new members. New players are encouraged to join one of the other campaigns.
results.name: Lost at Sea

results.description:
Join DM James Walters in his first Wildpig Exclusive RPG! This is a great adventure for new players. There is a 4-player limit for this game.

The College of Garthun has prided itself on generating some of the greatest arcane masters in all of Reverat. Within its walls, the college possesses an artifact of immense power, the Arcane Vault, said to provide the school with an unlimited source of magical energy.

Recently, strange events have been taking place throughout the College of Garthun. Students and faculty have been reporting weird noises, and dark figures moving along the college grounds. Dean Thwarn has sent out the call for adventurers to investigate the strange happenings menacing his school. Can you solve the mystery of the Arcane Vault?
results.name: D&D 5E: The Mystery of the Arcane Vault

$19 prepaid, or $29 cash/door.

Dear Smart Networkers,

Join us in this exciting facilitated networking event where you will learn secrets of using meetup.com to grow your business, have opportunity to showcase your business through elevator pitches, and network with phenomenal business owners!

Some of the topics that will be covered are:

• Why meetup.com is ten times better than facebook and linkedIn ads, both in terms of reaching your target market, and doing so on an amazing budget

• How meetup.com is different from all other social media platforms

• How to build a community of potential prospects, and serve it in a way that you never need to depend on advertising

• How to create your first group on meetup.com, and how to keep it growing over time

• How to get sponsors and let your group pay for itself

We will follow a structured format :

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration

6:15-6:25pm - 30 secs elevator pitches

6:25-6:45pm - Meetup tips from Dr. Kool

6:45-7:00pm - Brainstorming session

7:00-8:00pm- Targeted/Open networking

Cost: It is only $19 prepaid, or $29 cash/door.

*Check out the video from one of our events: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lp2d4dX6rtQ

About the speaker:

Dr. Kool is a business coach, speaker, and information marketer. He has successfully grown NY Connect and Grow to more than 4500 small business owners on meetup.com. He is also the creator of multiple video courses related to networking and marketing.

Few rave reviews from one of our past event:

Great insight on my 30-second commercial. Vincent's insight made all the difference. Great job again by our hosts, Aditi and Dr. Kool! Isn't this a terrific group?- Bruce Anapol

Excellent event. Dr. Kool provided an extremely professional environment in which to network. He also taught very valuable information to help us pitch our businesses more efficiently and effectively. I would highly recommend this group and will see you again at future meetups. I made incredible contacts at this event and I look forward to following up with such entrepreneurial and creative professionals!- Denise

Everything about this event was a success. A great, motivated, friendly group of people, an excellent presentation by Dr. Kool, enough structure to help everyone connect in the best possible way - can't wait for the next one!"- Emma Larkins

Excellent meetup. Dr Kool is an excellent business consultant and the environment is perfect for constructive criticism. This was easily the best meetup event that I have ever attended. I'll definitely attend again next month!- Vinay Rawal

Wonderful event. I love the structured aspect to learn then network in a more focused way. I will be back with friends.- Nika Roback

Aditi and Dr. Kool always go the extra mile to make sure everyone walks out of their meetups with prospects!- Jake

results.description:
**You must rsvp through www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc (MANDATORY)**

If you did not sign up for the class through the website, you will not be able to attend!


This class is for people who enjoy programming, but don't want to spend their lives dealing with databases and servers. Here, we'll show you how to make art through code. Creative coding is an exploding medium in the art world that allows for deep creativity and expressiveness. We're going to be building a simple particle system in Open Frameworks - a well rounded, open source platform in C++ that is both accessible and powerful. You will be guided through the example code, but we encourage you to change things as we go and get creative.

What you'll need:
1. Some knowledge of programming. While the course is meant to be beginner friendly, you should know basic concepts like for loops, classes, functions, etc... We will NOT be going over these.

2. A laptop with Open Frameworks and its proper IDE installed:
Windows - Visual Studio 2012
OS X (10.6 - 10.11) - XCode
Linux - CodeBlocks

Get Open Frameworks here:http://openframeworks.cc/download/older.html

We will be using pre release v0.8.4, so make sure you get the right version. We will not be spending class time downloading or setting anything up, so once you've downloaded it and extracted it, go into the examples subfolder, and run one of them to make sure everything is working ok. If you're having trouble, you can email the instructor before Monday the 16th at [masked].
results.name: Creative Coding with Open Frameworks [Intro]

Protractor codelab


Source code

Slides

This meetup will be different from previous meetups. During this meetup you will learn how to use Protractor by following a codelab.

The Protractor codelab will give you a chance to write protractor tests against an AngularJS application. This event is recommended for engineers who are familiar with JavaScript, testing, and Node.

Requirements:

• You need to bring a laptop

• Your laptop must have git and node installed

IMPORTANT: You will not admitted into the meetup if you don't have a laptop

Agenda:

6:00pm - Doors open, Food, Drinks and Socializing

6:30pm - Protractor codelab

8:00pm - The end
results.how_to_find_us: Enter Chelsea market using the 9th Ave door. Then take the stairs or the elevator on the right (next to a security guard) to the second floor.

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!

***

***

***Please have a government issued form of ID with you. ***

***We will be meeting at a new location, the North Academic Center of CCNY***

This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.


This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone posses a question, so bring questions!


Some topics of discussion are:
-Install/configuration assistance/ (possibly a "getting started" guide)
-Documentation/Standards/"Best Practices"
-Current events/Conventions
-Release testing/bug reporting
-Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)


You may also find someone willing to debate VI vs Emacs (however don't expect a conclusion to it ! )


A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

(If you are working a problem , some log/debugging information will be required)


Bring a project, topic or questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects.
(Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves )

The coordinators can also provide pointers based on their experience on how to get up and running as well as documentation and other resources for new users.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the North Academic Center and ask security where NAC 5/110 is. You'll need to show ID. (The 137 st. City College stop on the 1 and the 145th stop on B/D)
results.name: NYLUG Open hacker hours

results.description:
We have a special opportunity to have renowned photographer Rick Smolan screen his latest film "The Human Face of Big Data" (based on his book of the same name) for us at CUNY's Tow-Knight Center for Entrepreneurial Journalism at the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism on Tuesday Nov 17th, at 6pm. The film features conversations with more than thirty leading voices in the fields of data science, artificial intelligence, technology and digital medicine.

In addition, Rick will be on hand after the screening to participate on a panel discussion about big data, moderated by CUNY's very own Jeff Jarvis, Director and Professor at the Tow-Knight Center for Entrepreneurial Journalism. Jeff and his team are graciously providing light snacks and beverages as well. 

Please note - ID is required at security. Do not forget to bring it! And please include your first and last name in your CUNY Tech Meetup profile so that I may give an accurate attendee list to security. 

Also note - we're expecting a full house so if you RSVP yes, and your plans change, please change your RSVP so that waitlisted members may get a spot.

Also note - This meetup includes a film screening. The film will start promptly at 6:10pm. Please arrive no later than 6:00pm. Do not be late!

Evening Schedule - 

6:00pm: arrival 

6:10pm: film starts 

7:00pm: Jeff Jarvis, Rick Smolan, Steven Adler 

8:00pm: reception


8:30pm: end
results.name: "The Human Face of Big Data" Private Screening and Discussion

results.description:
Everyone is invited to our last meetup of 2015. Come and enjoy the talks and the networking with fellow OpenStackers.

The meetup will be at BlackRock in Auditorium 11D/E on the 11th floor. Please go up the escalators as you enter the building and present your ID at the Blackrock reception

Title: 
Herding Cats:  How To Effectively Corral Metrics In A Multi-Tenant Cloud


Abstract:
A big question in the OpenStack community today is “How should I monitor my OpenStack environment?”  Effectively tracking the resource bounds of disparate domains, and extrapolating these back to user-scoped applications and services is not easy.  But when done right, clever multi-tenant monitoring can help you improve the availability and performance of your entire deployment. In this talk, we'd like to share some of our approaches to monitoring OpenStack in a dynamic, multi-tenant environment. We'll give a brief demonstration of techniques for managing your OpenStack metrics, using dimensions to better group and filter your metrics, and leveraging them for more informed correlation, orchestration, and alerting.

Speaker:
Aaditya Talwai is a Software Engineer at Datadog. Prior to that, he cut his teeth on solar financing software in San Francisco. He was born and raised in South Bangalore in a family of avid bowlers.

Title:
Neutron Networking with Midokura

Abstract:
TBA

Speaker:
TBA
results.name: Monitoring A Multi-Tenant Cloud by Datadog/ Neutron Networking by Midokura

results.description:
***REGISTRATION OPEN***

On Tuesday November 17th @ 6 PM, you will have the opportunity to discover 8 innovative start ups at Atelier, the co-working space launched and housed by Belcham, the Belgian-American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. This pre-holiday edition (and most likely this year's last) will feature the following companies: DOT, Collibra, Style Sage, NG Data, Glassful, Butterfly, Night Advisor and Darcmatter. Big Data in all its flavors is the name of the game here, so be there or be square!

| Please note these changes! |

1) Each company will have 6 minutes to present followed by 4 minutes Q&A

2) A nominal charge of $10.00 will be requested when you register. (As we're typically at capacity, this will enable us to scale-up in terms of attendee quality, as well as cover part of our costs for staging and organizing the event - reminding you that we are a non-profit)

I'm happy to announce the new names of our participating startups:

- Butterfly

Butterfly Effect: Short, regular feedback can drive big, positive changes in your team and your company!



- DOT


dot


Where it's at! Dot lets you comment at and about places.


- Collibra


COLLIBRA HELPS COMPANIES GET MORE BUSINESS VALUE FROM THEIR DATA

Data Management has become a critical business process. New business applications are needed to support this process. Collibra focuses on automating data management processes by providing business-focused applications where collaboration and ease-of-use come first. We believe traditional data management vendors don’t have the expertise and company DNA to solve this problem.


-Style Sage


We analyze competitors to help you adjust your next season's strategy, identify opportunities in new retail channel partners, and monitor what is happening with your merchandise across channels.


Real-time alerts on competitor sales and promotion activities help you proactively design differentiated promotions strategies to swiftly capture shoppers as well as identify overstock inventory that needs to be unloaded.

- NG Data


NGDATA is the customer experience management solutions company that enables organizations to maximize the value of their customer relationships. Through its breakthrough solution, Lily Enterprise, companies can now create and maintain individual and actionable customer profiles – Lily Customer DNA – in real time, resulting in highly effective targeting and more personalized customer experiences.



- Glasful

Change the way millennials  consume wine today—and anything else tomorrow. No one wants to feel unsure at the point of checkout, but some products require a level of knowledge that only comes with experience and expertise. That’s where we come in. We remove the burden of choosing by giving you what you want.




- Darcmatter

DarcMatter provides access to private investment opportunities that are typically reserved for institutional investors. By utilizing proprietary structuring and technology, DarcMatter is able to provide a frictionless process for both investors and private issuers while remaining fully compliant of all current financial regulations.


- Night Advisor

=========================================================


I look forward to see you all again in big numbers for what is going to be another one of this memorable moments ! 

As always, beer for our MeetUps is sponsored by Duvel.

Be there or be square - and share the word.

Yvan De Munck

• Sarah Poyet will present The Glass Files, the place for History on the Internet where families, cultural institutions and corporate alumni networks collaborate to tell their stories and make them intersect with history.

• Matt Kicinski of ArtGig will be presenting on the topic of testing software products with a focus on the recent round of playtesting ArtGig has been doing on their latest game.

RSVP now and join us on Tuesday for a great night!

results.description:
STSANY welcomes NEW MEMBERS, FIRST-TIMERS, Pros, Non-Pros, Semi-Pros and invited GUESTS to this workshop on Tuesday, November 17 and all those in the future-TBA. 

Meetup Fees: Members: $20; Participating Guests; $15; Observers: $10. Policy: Exact amount in cash at the door, when you attend each meetup.

Please arrive 10 minutes prior to the meetup, if possible, as elevators are busy at that hour.

 ***RSVP DEADLINE is 10:00 p.m. on Monday,  November 16 for this November 17 meetup. You MUST RSVP on the posting page, and DOUBLE-CONFIRM by November 15 even if you already RSVPd. If you miss the deadline and would like to attend, please send me an email and include your email address and phone number. I will respond!

***ATTENTION "Looking for Christmas" HOLIDAY EVENT VOLUNTEERS and those who would like to volunteer: Be sure to bring your written songs, poems, stories and what you will say to the audience to all workshops, so I can put the program together, in writing. You must attend this workshop and others during November and December to work on your material. 

 ATTENTION New Holiday Volunteers: Spots are still open for our December 17 and 27 events. We are looking for instrumentalists (as well as singers/actors) for December 17, as no piano is available to us at that event.

Kindly contact me IMMEDIATELY if you wish to volunteer, AND attend at least two workshops in November and/or December to be considered for one or both of these two events. We will present some solos and group numbers as part of our holiday programs.

***IMPORTANT NEW POLICY: YOU MUST DOUBLE CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP or change it by one day prior to any meetup to avoid no-shows or last minute cancellations, even it you have already RSVPd before the deadline. It takes time and effort to schedule a meetup, SO PLEASE BE CONSIDERATE by adhering to this policy. Thank you!

All workshops benefit members who want to improve their vocal, acting  and instrumental technique and interpretation. They provide a safe, supportive, AFFORDABLE, enjoyable atmosphere which addresses self-confidence, stage fright and other matters important to our members. Workshops are a first step in providing performance and volunteer opportunities.

MEETUPS serve several purposes: 

* Learning: You are given instruction in singing and acting technique and interpretation, and you also learn from watching and listening to others. 

* Networking: You are encouraged to exchange information with other members (before, at a break and after the meetup) with whom you feel an affinity, personally and/or performance-wise, and to possibly collaborate with them on  STSANY projects or outside the meetup;

* Volunteering: Please volunteer to be an assistant organizer (talk to me about your special talents!), and to help out at our various events;

* Social: Enjoy meeting and getting to know others either before, during a break, or after meetup is over.

IMPORTANT! Although I ALWAYS send updates, if necessary, be sure to keep checking the postings for meetups and your emails about the day and time of each meetup. Weather conditions, illness and unforeseen events can cause cancellations. 

What to bring to all meetup workshops: (Please read, carefully!) 

 Singers: Bring 2 contrasting songs of any style (entire sheet music) - 2 copies, please. If you don't have written songs, let me know and I can provide some at the meetup.

NOTE! If you don't wish to sing solo, please join us in our group numbers. Getting started is the important thing.  The shyness will subside, little by little.

Actors: Bring 2 contrasting monologues, poems or recitations - 2 copies, please.

Instrumentalists: Be prepared to play one or two contrasting pieces of any style.

YOU ARE ENCOURAGED TO RECORD the meetups for continued learning and inspiration!

NOTE: PRIVATE LESSONS are offered from 11:00 a.m to 8:00 p.m., by appointment, on weekdays/nights, and on Saturdays (sometimes Sundays) from 10:00 a.m.-1:00 p.m. Member discount cost: $65 for 45 minutes. Some further discounts may be available for low income members. Read your emails. RSVP on each posting, separately, for lessons and kindly adhere to all the details.

NOTE: TO read about STSANY's GOALS and reviews, click on pages: http://www.meetup.com/SOMETHING-TO-SING-ABOUT-IN-NEW-YORK/about/

To see and hear members perform, please VISIT and SUBSCRIBE TO our youtube channel by clicking on this link: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlmaMusica/videos?view_as=public

Be inspired and live your DREAMS! Carpe diem!

All the best,

Anna Bartos

www.annabartos.com

Founder-Director, STSANY since 2010

Founder-Director, Flor y Canto Chamber Ensemble since 1998

NYU Vocal Faculty from[masked] 

REVIEWS by STSANY members, fellow performers and audience members: 

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting manyhelpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor, playwright and STSANY showcase performer.

It was a wonderful session w/a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Great session; good, helpful feedback; supportive.____Barbara, Member, STSANY

“ Fortunately for me I had the pleasure of Anna helping me with my singing technique which is something that I have always to do. I am looking forward to more meetups and meeting new people. You should all attend this meetup whether you are experienced or a beginner (like me). You will be able to discover something so unique and wonderful about yourself with this group. I can guarantee it! ”______Chels, Members, STSANY

An excellent meetup! Anna knows her stuff and helped me improve my performances; the other members/performers are talented and friendly and fun."____Glen, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on (for longer than I'd like to say) into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. I am eager to do more! Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. I would definitely like to perform in this type of event again. For me, once a season would be good (3-4 times a year)."____Rebecca, Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding the musicale. I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

What a delightful surprise! One often doesn't know what to expect of a showcase! Congratulations to Anna, a real pro, and an impressive mentor to a diverse array of talent. The 'meet-up' seems to be a real resource for both the performers and those of us in the audience.  Keep up the good work!____Mary Jay, Seasoned Senior Performer

It was a privilege to work with Anna Bartos on this 9/11 memorial concert. All of the performers were of high caliber and the audience rewarded our efforts with heartfelt applause. The program, with its mixture of styles and its emphasis on Americana, was just perfect for the anniversary date. I had a great time yesterday. It was a meaningful and well-organized concert.___ Moshe Knoll, Classical pianist.

Thank you so much for inviting us to perform on this wonderful 9/11 concert.___Rosa Hyewon, Classical Guitarist

results.description:
Join the conversation: http://slack.cdnyc.co

</a>

-------------------------------------------------- 

Sign-in & networking at 6:15, talks at 6:30. 

--------------------------------------------------  

SYNOPSIS

Jenkins Workflow is an easy way to automate complex continuous delivery pipelines more flexibly and fluidly than was previously possible. We’ll look at an integrated delivery workflow process and learn how to easily apply these principles to develop generic CD pipelines. Join us in this technical presentation to learn more about:

  • Implementing CD pipelines with Jenkins Workflow

  • Workflow multi-branch integration

  • CD-as-code (Pipeline as code)

--------------------------------------------------

BIO

<a href="https://twitter.com/xebialabs"></a>

results.description:
New York Perlmongers will hold a technical meeting on Tuesday, Nov 17, 6:15 pm.  MediaMath has moved from Midtown to 4 World Trade Center and this will be our first meeting in this new location.  (Enter at Liberty and Greenwich Streets; best subways:  4, 5 to Wall Street; R to Cortlandt Street.)

Agenda:

Practical Regular Expression Benchmarking
Eric (XlogicX) Davisson

At best, its not very accurate to test an NFA expression on any old string.  Even a terribly designed expression can speed through the right string like nothing is wrong. This talk is about a perl script that automatically generates 'evil' strings, benchmarks, and ranks your expression list.


A Taste of Taxonomies
Jim Keenan

A taxonomy is a tree-like data structure in which each node can trace its origin back to a root node in a unique way.  If you are presented with a data file in CSV format and are told that the data therein is a taxonomy, how can you verify that claim?  This presentation will introduce basic taxonomic concepts and a CPAN library, Parse-Taxonomy, which provides methods to validate a taxonomy and to transform a taxonomy among various formats such as materialized path, adjacent list and nested sets.


Mitigating Technical Risk Through Test-First Practices
Richard Elberger

This is the first talk of a four part series covering the conversion of monolithic web code bases (in this case, Perl CGI) to a horizontally scalable and compose-able micro services architecture using the Mojolicious framework.  Because refactoring tried and true code can be a daunting task, we’ll first look at mitigating technical risk through applying test-first practices.  Further sessions will walk through how to apply common and industry accepted service oriented patterns, uncover common issues when developing a horizontally scalable architecture, and discover techniques for deploying these services to the cloud.  Without a doubt, this series will get you excited about realizing web scale with Perl.
results.name: November New York Perlmongers Technical Meeting

Developer Tips for Office 365 and SharePoint

Join us! Our next meetup we'll be doing quick 15-20 minute Lightning Talks on a variety of topics. 

As usual we will have food and refreshments and prizes!!! This will be our last meetup of the year.

Topics

1) SharePoint Taxonomy Tools Online - By Ben Steinhauser


My latest CodePlex contribution to the SharePoint community. Your one stop shop for SharePoint 2013 and SharePoint Online term set management and migrations. Runs on any computer (client or server) with .NET 4.0 or later. Connects remotely to SharePoint using Client Object Model. Ton's of features.

http://sptaxonomytoolsonline.codeplex.com/

2) MyBoard, behind the scenes of this Single Page App (SPA)- By Paul Tavares

A SharePoint Trello inspired task management tool built as a Single Page Application, SPA (literally one file). We'll look at the functionality this provides along with concepts behind creating it.

https://paultavares.wordpress.com/my-things/myboard-a-sharepoint-kanban-task-management-system/

3) What's Not in SharePoint 2016 - by Michael Mukalian

4) Quick Setting up of custom Apps(Addon) Development on your Laptop - by Tom Chaundry


When we want to develop and debug CSOM application using AngularJS and Bootstrap, we want to create an App and deploy it. When SharePoint default installation is run on the Virtual Machine on our laptop, we cannot start deploying the Apps developed through visual studio. We have to perform some extra steps so that we can develop our custom Apps(Addon) using Visual Studio and test and debug on our Laptop. This presentation will high light those extra steps and demonstrate how to deploy custom App(Addon) using Visual Studio.

5) On-Prem Powershell vs. Office 365 Powershell - by Becky Isserman

A comparison between on-prem commandlets and CSOM with Office 365 and Powershell.

6) Angular and SharePoint REST APIS - By Mario Rodriguez


Demo a sample Angular project and how to port it into SharePoint.  Demo will provide some insight into how to interact with a SharePoint list using a Single Page App (SPA).

results.description:
In Deloitte’s 2011 Volunteer Impact Study, the company interviewed 1500 millennials who work at companies with 1000 or more employees and looked for correlations between volunteering and company satisfaction. The study found that there is an almost 30% difference in positive perception of company culture, and an almost 20% difference in company satisfaction, between those who volunteer and those who do not.

In today’s socially-conscious world, HR Managers understand how important an employee engagement strategy is to retention and recruitment goals. Almost every major company has an employee giving and volunteer program. However, the dirty secret whispered in the back rooms of most nonprofits is that most employee engagement programs require more effort than they are worth to the nonprofit beneficiary.

In this shoot-out-style event, hear representatives of the corporate/HR and nonprofit sectors debate the often-competing interests at play in employee engagement and philanthropy. And learn from some of the managers of the best employee engagement programs in the country, who will speak about how to model partnerships to provide maximum value to both stakeholders: the company (and its employees) and the nonprofit beneficiary (and its constituents).

Moderator

Jorge Fontanez, Founder/CEO, Marca Studio

Between 2011 and 2014, Jorge developed and oversaw Chase Community Giving, a J.P. Morgan Chase initiative that revolutionized corporate philanthropy. Most recently, Jorge is the Founder and CEO of Marca Studio, an independent, strategic marketing consultancy serving purpose-driven brands, nonprofits, and foundations. He also serves as an Advisory Council Member to Givkwik, a service that simplifies charitable giving by removing barriers for people looking to discover and support more causes. 

Panelists

Sarah Conte, Director of Corporate Engagement, Per Scholas

Sarah began her career at Per Scholas, a nonprofit social venture that provides free IT job training and career opportunities for low-income individuals, as Corporate Relations and Volunteer Manager in 2013. In this role, she was tasked with creating and implementing a structured volunteer program aimed at engaging corporations and industry professionals in assisting Per Scholas students. Since then, Sarah has grown the program to include over 50 industry partners who donate their time. In her current role, Sarah continues to manage and grow the volunteer program and is also responsible for creating and maintaining employer relationships.

Annie Scurfield, Agribusiness Project Manager, The Earth Institute 

A participant of the GlaxoSmithKline PULSE Volunteer Partnership, a skills-based volunteering initiative that matches GSK employees to partner nonprofits for three or six months, Annie is currently working full-time on the Millennium Villages Project at the Earth Institute. In this role, she helps scale the piloted Agribusiness program, assesses agricultural extension service needs, summarizes best management practices of soil nutrients for priority crops, advises on data collection, and improves the design of the Lead Farmer Program. In addition to promoting CVM products and covering key hospital accounts at GSK, she has mentored new representatives through the training process and led an initiative to merge the planning activities of former Glaxo Wellcome and Smith Kline Beecham employees.

Kim Gillman, Senior Consultant, Advisory Services, Taproot Foundation

Kim comes to The Taproot Foundation, a nonprofit organization that engages professionals in pro bono service, with a background in non-profit management, organizational development, and a deep commitment to social change. She partners with companies to design, implement, and scale high-quality pro bono initiatives that maximize each company’s unique skills and expertise. Prior to Taproot, Kim worked as the Individual Giving Manager at City Year New York, a non-profit organization focused on keeping students in school and on the track to success. 

Ali Marano, Head of CAO Talent Pipeline, J.P. Morgan Chase

As the head of the Chief Administrative Office Talent Pipeline at J.P. Morgan Chase, Ali focuses on identifying, attracting, and engaging talent to meet the diversity and innovation needs of the CAO through the execution of traditional, alternative, and social good programs. Her group has three targeted pillars: University Engagement, which identifies the CAO’s critical university relationships and identifies talent while building the J.P. Morgan Chase brand; Pipeline Programs, which focus on increasing and diversifying the talent pipeline via early identification, talent acquisition enhancements, and exploration of new talent sources; and CAO Social Good Programs, aimed at attracting and engaging existing and prospective employees through innovative programs that support social good organizations and youth skill development.

This event is hosted in partnership with Net Impact NYC. NINYC is the New York City Professional chapter of Net Impact, a global community of 60,000+ leaders who are committed to changing the world through business. The Net Impact New York City Professional Chapter (NINYC) activates a network of professionals to leverage the marketplace for sustainable social & environmental change. We do this by connecting the right people, knowledge sharing and inspiring positive change. For more information, please visit netimpactnyc.org.

Alright, so I can't get enough of this stuff! One day I will have to go back to Mexico on a trek to discover some supreme tacos. In the interim NY has an amazing plethora of authenticity. Enter Taqueria Tehuitzingo.


I found this spot on one of my typical treks through the streets of NY. Naturally intrigued, I walk in. The ambiance small and tight, the smells; captivating. I knew this had to be NEXT. Tehuitzingo is a highly rated little joint in Hell's Kitchen. Named after the city In Puebla South East Mexico. They serve up lots of authentic flavors from the motherland which you can taste in every bite. Outside of the usual stuff they even have the "odd" proteins for tacos like Chicharron, (Pork Skin) Oreja, (Pig Ear) Cabeza, (Beef Head) Lengua, (Beef Tongue) Barbacoa, (Goat Meat) and Tripa (Beef Tripe) If you're adventurous AWESOME. If not you can get some good ole chicken, fish, beef and pork and call it a night.


• Yes! That's Mole!

They even have all day Breakfast so you can go ahead and order those  Chilaquilles you've been dying for if you're feeling that kinda vibe. They have soft drinks inside but they are also BYOB (SCORE!!) and if you are down for some more after meetup action I have some spots for you.


Join me on this flavor quest for some great tacos at this small excellent Taco Tuesday soon to be classic joint.

DeRM

P.S. Note there are 2 locations. We will be going to the closer one on 9th avenue. If that one is packed we can go to the 10th ave location.

results.description:
Abstract:

Visualization and The City: Projects in Urban Data Visualization and Sports Analytics

About five years ago, our research group moved to New York City after almost a decade at the University of Utah. While many academic moves have negligible effect on the research program of faculty members, our move has had a profound effect in the research topics being pursued,
and also in how our research is being translated into practice. The collaboration with NYC agencies and companies (including AT&T, KPF, and MLB.com) have fundamentally impacted our projects by providing a
strong foundation of real problems to be solved.

In this talk, we will describe some projects in urban data
visualization and sports analytics. In particular, we will describe Urbane, a 3D framework to support data driven decision making in urban development, developed in collaboration with Kohn Pedersen Fox Associates (KPF), and the Baseball Metrics Engine, which is part of
MLB.com's Statcast (developed in collaboration with Dr. Carlos Dietrich).

This work has a large number of collaborators, including Juliana Freire, Huy Vo, Harish Doraiswamy, Theo Damoulas, Nivan Ferreira, Marcos Lage, Luc Wilson, Heidi Werner, and Muchan Park. Our work has been funded by grants/gifts from Moore and Sloan Foundations, NSF, NASA, DOE, MLB.com, DARPA, The State of New York, AT&T, and IBM.

Bio:

Claudio Silva is a Professor of Computer Science and Engineering and Data Science at New York University. Claudio’s research lies in the intersection of visualization, data analysis, and geometric computing, and recently he has been interested in the analysis of urban and sports data. Silva's work has received a number of major awards. In 2013, he was elected an Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers fellow and in 2014 he won the IEEE Visualization Technical Achievement Award. He helped develop MLB.com's Statcast player tracking system, which won the Alpha Award for Best Analytics Innovation/Technology at the 2015 MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference. In 2015, he was elected Chair of the IEEE Technical Committee on Visualization and Computer Graphics.
results.name: Visualization and The City with Claudio Silva

results.description:
Worldwide discrimination against atheists is real and documented. A survey from April 2014 by the Pew Research Center actually found that, for 2016 US presidential hopefuls, the most negatively viewed of all tested ‘traits’ was “not believing in God”! (In comparison, “being a woman” actually fared rather well, everything being relative.)

In such a system, in which atheism/agnosticism is perceived a major electoral weakness and “presidential candidate while woman” is even a ‘trait’ to be measured, one might expect a certain level of solidarity, camaraderie even, among freethinkers of all stripes. After all, only around 6% of Americans describe themselves as either atheist or agnostic...

Nevertheless, grievances within the skeptic/humanist/atheist community have accrued for years and continue to abound with disheartening regularity, on accounts of both ‘benevolent’ and hostile forms of sexism. More than disheartening, this is even maddeningly hypocritical, given how the community prides itself in critical thought and rationality and since, well, misogyny is… ahem… rationally untenable! 



*** 

Some food for thought, with the following links, offering much to discuss (optional reading for the meetup, as usual). Enjoy! 

A] "Do Atheists have a Sexual Harassment Problem?"

B] "Sam Harris, The Criticism of Bad Ideas, and Sexist Appeals To Biology"

C] "Gender Equality in the Secular Movement" (VIDEO)

D] "The Great Geek Sexism Debate"

E] "Women in Secularism – The Challenges We Face and How We Can Overcome Them Together"
results.name: Where are the Women in Secularism?

Would it be far-fetched to say that you're tired of looking for writing partners or people to read your scripts/stories? Well, look no more!


The Story Beats Lab is an intense writers lab for aspiring and semi-professional TV/Film writers (and authors) interested in workshopping stories still in pre-development, while also getting professional feedback.

We meet weekly to workshop new scripts and stories. 

We orchestrate pitchfests (designed to improve how writers pitch their loglines), offer plot development feedback and short stage readings (via an opening page test). Writers are encouraged to bring material related to feature scripts, pilot/spec episodes, shorts, web series scripts, and novel outlines.

Our labs are specifically tailored for TV/Film scriptwriters and authors during the pre-development stages. If you desire real feedback, from real writers, as deep in the zone as you - we dare you to join our group. 

Our mission is to help scriptwriters and authors during pre-development, while also increasing efficiency and quality output.

results.description:
JOIN HVH TO VIEW A CELESTIAL WONDER.

Event Description:

This will be a night hike to Bearfort Ridge to watch the Leonid Meteor Shower.  We are hiking up in the dark, so you MUST BRING A FLASHLIGHT OR HEADLIGHT. 

Hike Description:

A fast paced hike up to Bearfot Ridge.  We will follow the Blue and White Stateline Trail for about 1 mile, then turn onto the Yellow Ernest Walker Trail for another 0.5 miles.  When we're too cold or tired to continue watching the meteor shower, we'll go back down the same way. 

Distance: ~3 Miles

Elevation Gain: ~600 feet

Trailhead Parking:[masked], [masked]

Map: NYNJTC North Jersey Trails

Suggestion:

I recommend dressing warm and carrying extra layers.  I'd suggest a blanket and maybe something to sit on as well.  I'll be bringing my backpacking stove and hot chocolate mix, you may want to do the same. 

Getting There:

We will now be meeting at the A&P/Sears Parking Lot in Hewitt, NJ.  It's just a few miles away and this will allow us to consolidate cars and ensure that we have enough space at the trailhead.

If you're late and need to come directly to the trailhead, that's fine.  The trailhead coordinates are listed above.

The Trail Head is also within walking distance of a 196/197 bus stop. The 196 Bus leaving Port Authority at 5:20 arrives at 6:33pm. It looks like the latest bus back is at 10:26 and it arrives back at Port Authority around midnight.  I'M NOT A BUS PERSON, DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH.


Apres' Hiking

After the hike we will likely go to Murhpy's in Greenwood Lake, NY.


    
NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: HVH SPECIAL: View The LEONID Meteor Shower from Bearfort Mountain
