results.description:
Come out, enjoy a glass of wine and meet fellow female founders.

As founders, finding peers for support and to bounce ideas off can help us be more successful. So, treat yourself! Come out, buy yourself a glass of wine and make new friends in a casual setting. 

This event starts at 6:30PM and we ask that you arrive by 7:15PM. We are not charging for the event, but the venue requires that we all order at least one drink and tip the bar tender / server generously.

PLEASE DO:

-- Please be responsible with your RSVP and keep in mind that space is limited.

-- Please do come, ready to relax and treat yourself to a fun evening.

-- Wear whatever you typically wear for work, no dress code. We want to promote a judgement-free atmosphere. 

PLEASE DO NOT:

-- Come with a business marketing goal or intent to push your product or service to the group.

-- Hand out marketing materials or demo your app at the event.
results.how_to_find_us: WinedUp 913 Broadway, New York, NY 10010 (upstairs!)
results.name: Wine & New Friends: Female Founders Social Event

results.description:
Postlight is starting a speaker series and we're proud that Gary Chou (http://garychou.com) has agreed to be our first speaker. He'll talk about the work he's doing at Orbital (http://orbital.nyc/), a space in downtown Manhattan for people developing products and ideas, and its origins from a class he teaches at SVA called Entrepreneurial Design. 

In addition to our friend Gary, we'll have some food and drinks here. The entire event should be pretty chill. Bring a friend or come by and introduce yourself. If you want to learn more about Gary, read on. 

Gary Chou is a fun guy based in Brooklyn, NY.

Currently, he spends his time at Orbital, a home for developing and launching new ideas.

Gary also teaches Entrepreneurial Design at the School of Visual Arts MFA in Interaction Design Program and advises Austin Center for Design, which exists to transform society through design and design education; and Venture for America, which seeks to revitalize American cities and communities through entrepreneurship.

Gary previously worked at Union Square Ventures, a NYC-based venture capital firm, where he created and managed the Union Square Ventures Network of portfolio companies, and held product roles at tech companies small and large.

In his work with independent creators, Gary executive produced Surrogate Valentine (SXSW '11) and Daylight Savings (SXSW '12), two films by Dave Boyle. He frequently collaborates with musician Goh Nakamura on web-related projects.
results.name: Come meet Gary Chou and talk about entrepreneurial design

results.description:
</a>Hello NY AEM Community,

Announcing our next NY AEM Meetup on Nov 17, 2015 @ 6:30p.m. 

Peter and Joey, our friends at AXIS 41, authors of <a href="http://aempodcast.com">AEM Podcast will be talking about "Developing with the Dispatcher in Mind."


An often forgotten about piece of AEM development is the caching layer of the AEM infrastructure called the Dispatcher.  And it is forgotten about at a websites peril.  Peter Nash and Joey Smith will discuss how he AEM infrastructure is normally setup, some misconceptions, what a dispatcher does for you, how it works, what to do if the site isn’t caching properly, how to diagnose problems, and some tools to help developers use the dispatcher better. 


Speaker Bios:

</a>

<a href="http://aempodcast.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/Peter.jpg">

Peter Nash

Peter has been a Technical Project Manager in the web development industry since 2006, specializing in Adobe Experience Manager for the last three of those years. Peter serves as the Editor In Chief for AEM Podcast.

</a> <a href="http://aempodcast.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/Joey.jpg">


</a>

Joey Smith

Joey has been a Software Developer and Systems/Server Administrator since 1999, specializing in AEM for the last two years. Joey serves as the Chief Technology Adviser for AEM Podcast

Thank you Peter, Joey and AXIS 41 for flying all the way from Salt Lake City to speak to our group. 

Thanks to Smartling.com for hosting this event. 

Smartling is changing the way brands globalize content. From websites and applications, to documents and more, Smartling’s Global Fluency Platform allows for enterprise-wide integration.


Free Beer provided to all attendees. 

Also announcing <a href="http://www.meetup.com/Worldwide-Adobe-CQ5-AEM-Meetup-Community/">The Worldwide Adobe CQ / AEM Meetup Community.  This group is an attempt to bring together The Worldwide AEM community on Meetup. The Global AEM community plans to meet once a month in 2016 over webex. 

Call for Organizers, Speakers & Hosts: If you are interested in organizing, speaking and/or hosting an AEM Meetup in New York, San Francisco, Chicago or Virtual/Webex; we are now putting together a schedule for 2016 in all these cities. Please email [masked]. Thanks.
results.name: Developing with the Dispatcher in Mind by Peter Nash and Joey Smith

Learn all about what's include in Azure Mobile Services!

Speaker

James Quick, Microsoft

2. What's New in C# 6?

C# 6 is out, packed with all sorts of awesome new features that you can take advantage of across all platforms, including your mobile apps! In this session we'll take a look at the evolution of C# over the years, what's new in the latest version, and even peek into what's coming in the next version of the language.


Speaker

Greg Shackles is a Principal Engineer at Olo. He is a Xamarin MVP, Microsoft MVP, host of the Gone Mobile podcast, organizer of the NYC Mobile .NET Developers Group, author of Mobile Development with C#, and also a monthly columnist with Visual Studio Magazine.


Outside of technology, Greg is obsessed with heavy metal, baseball, and craft beer, sometimes in combination, and is also an aspiring homebrewer. 

Pizza will be provided courtesy of Xamarin

results.description:
While traditional markets are stuck at the moment (UPDATE: They turned technically negative at the end of the week), THREE years after the JOBS Act was passed the SEC finally announced rules for Equity crowdfunding for startups and early stage businesses. This is a game changer for entrepreneurs looking for funding and investors looking for new ways to invest. We will have a brief introduction to these changes at the meeting. 

October 2015 has had many similarities to October 2014. One year ago, stock markets throughout the world were plunging. The drop was stopped when the European central bank (ECB) announced it would be doing QE -- quantitative easing (a form of money printing, which central banks have doing since 2008). This year, stock markets began falling apart in August starting in China. To stop the drop, the ECB said it would do even more QE than it was already doing. China announced its own stimulus measures as did Japan. The FED held off on raising interest rates from ZERO to 0.25% (at least two European central banks have NEGATIVE rates). Existing stimulus wasn't enough to keep stock prices up, more and more has been necessary -- as is the case with heroin addiction, an apt model to describe how the markets are currently working (UPDATE: The financial heroin no longer seems to be working).


We pointed out in the September and October meetings that one important piece of confirmation was missing to say there was a downtrend in place in the US. On the flip side, there is now no confirmation yet that the uptrend in stocks will last, although that may come (UPDATE: Forget about it). We will be telling you what to look for at the November meeting and why you should be paying attention to OIL (UPDATE: It's being hammered). 

AGENDA:

DAVID HARRIS, PhD - What it the market topping/bottoming model saying now. 

TBA - Crowdfunding: Title III Regulations Finalized -- This is a game changer for raising money for startups and early stage companies. 

Intermission and Networking

DARYL MONTGOMERY - Update on Economy, Stocks, Commodities and Currencies

There is a $10 admission charge to the meeting.
results.how_to_find_us: Show picture ID to guards, go to 15th floor
results.name: New York Investing Meetup November meeting

results.description:
What do the first ever sales rep at OpenTable, the senior leader at Salesforce, and the head of Latin America sales at Bloomberg say is the most important factor in the success of a sales organization?  It comes down to sales culture.


This month, we have the first ever sales rep hired at OpenTable who led them to epic success over a 12 year career before moving on to a few early stage startups.  Our second guest was an early employee for Salesforce and now leads their Salesforce for Startups group.  Our third guest headed up sales for Bloomberg in Latin America and several other financial firms.  Their common thread is that each focused on helping those organizations instill a strong and positive sales culture across their teams.


Join us for this conversation and learn how you can build a culture that drives high performance and gives sales reps and managers the incentive and room to succeed.
results.name: Sales Culture Talk w/ Salesforce, OpenTable & Bloomberg

results.description:
Bring a piece of jewelry that has a story… and don’t they all? Otherwise why do you wear it? Why is it important to you… it can be as simple as you bought it while on a memorable vacation or your great grandmother got it as a gift from her father or.. that brooch your aunt Kathy gave you.. or the cuff links/tie clip from your uncle Tony…


You get the picture. Every Thing (jewel) has a story.
Bring your jewels to show and tell.


Like Pinterest/Instagram/TBT but in person. Or Antiques Roadshow meets The Moth!

And remember you don't have to show & tell... you can just look & listen.


Winona Richardson, a Graduate Gemologist with 20 years of experience in the trade and whose area of Expertise is Antique, Vintage, and Estate Jewelry will be on hand to offer complimentary evaluations of any and all pieces that they wish to bring along to the event - costume or fine. PLEASE don’t bring jewels you don’t wear regularly. And if they can have them in relatively clean condition that would be advisable so they can be properly assessed.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the bar/lounge area!
results.name: Show & Tale: The Family Jewels

results.description:
Be on the forefront of the Braveheart Men's Movement to break down the walls between straight and men in the LGBTQA community. 


You will be involved in conversations you have never had before and hear points of views you've never considered. 

You will form new friendships, business partnerships and possibly a new relationship to your own masculinity. 

The event will consist of experiential exercises, networking and from our panel of experts. Non alcoholic beverages and snacks will be provided.

Our panel is an eclectic group of leaders who will be discussing how to break down the barriers that divide men and limit our lives. The members of the panel are:

Eduardo Placer - Social Impact Entrepreneur, Founder of Fearless Communicators
Cody Dodo - Gender Expert, Accupunturist, Founder of Internal Alchemy
Jason Dukes - Leadership & Diversity Coach

Learn how you can challenge the traditional constructs of masculinity and develop an authentic expression of Self that leads to a more fulfilling life and better results in business, relationships and health. 

We look forward to meeting you!

results.description:
All too often we see businesses with brilliant and unique strategies fail. Usually, it is in the execution. They’ve created experiences without understanding who they are designing for and what is most likely to engage them. 

Join us for a presentation and interactive conversation about identifying customers and creating experiences that delight. Hear from experts that have worked on projects that span from enterprise dashboards to mobile apps. Come learn how to look at products from the outside in, considering the perspective of your target customers. Leave with tactical design strategies you can use to define your customer personas and recognize where you fit into their journeys. We’re looking forward to meeting you and discussing how to get your ideas in front of the right people!

From startups to the Fortune 1000, Sachs Insights is a strategic research consultancy that partners with companies to understand each of their audiences, how they behave, what their points of delight and pain are and the optimal way to communicate with them.

Presenters from Sachs Insights:

Sarah Henn, SVP, Head of Research & Consulting

Sarah has led hundreds of UX design and qualitative research initiatives across industries including telecom, travel, fashion, retail, health & wellness, financial services and consumer products. Working seamlessly with diverse stakeholders from CMOs to UX designers, Sarah integrates business goals with research to inform and shape omni-channel touchpoints that serve the brand strategy and elevate the customer's experience.

Leslie Brown, Director, Research & Consulting

As a researcher with a background in videography, Leslie believes that the key to understanding consumer audiences is to understand their stories. To that end, she explores consumer behavior to help brands leverage key insights into tangible next steps—from identifying the ideal segment for a product to determining how various audiences will interact with a digital experience. Leslie’s research encompasses media & entertainment, education, finance, and e-commerce with everyone from children to senior citizens.

About Our Sponsor:

Lifion, by ADP, invites you to visit our new home for big ideas, ambitious folks, and those who are truly committed to delivering finely made products at scale. Join us after-hours for provocative talks, engaging discussions and some great opportunities to connect with serious thinkers and doers. Visit us at www.lifion.com for a calendar of upcoming events and current job opportunities. We look forward to meeting you soon!

results.description:
In Deloitte’s 2011 Volunteer Impact Study, the company interviewed 1500 millennials who work at companies with 1000 or more employees and looked for correlations between volunteering and company satisfaction. The study found that there is an almost 30% difference in positive perception of company culture, and an almost 20% difference in company satisfaction, between those who volunteer and those who do not.

In today’s socially-conscious world, HR Managers understand how important an employee engagement strategy is to retention and recruitment goals. Almost every major company has an employee giving and volunteer program. However, the dirty secret whispered in the back rooms of most nonprofits is that most employee engagement programs require more effort than they are worth to the nonprofit beneficiary.

In this round-table event, hear representatives of the corporate/HR and nonprofit sectors discuss the often-competing interests at play in employee engagement and philanthropy. And learn from some of the managers of the best employee engagement programs in the country, who will speak about how to model partnerships to provide maximum value to both stakeholders: the company (and its employees) and the nonprofit beneficiary (and its constituents).

PRICE IS $10

RSVP AT NYC CSR MEETUP


Moderator:

Jorge Fontanez, Founder/CEO, Marca Studio


Between 2011 and 2014, Jorge developed and oversaw Chase Community Giving, a J.P. Morgan Chase initiative that revolutionized corporate philanthropy. Most recently, Jorge is the Founder and CEO of Marca Studio, an independent, strategic marketing consultancy serving purpose­driven brands, nonprofits, and foundations. He also serves as an Advisory Council Member to Givkwik, a service that simplifies charitable giving by removing barriers for people looking to discover and support more causes.

Panelists:
Sarah Conte, Director of Corporate Engagement, Per Scholas
Sarah began her career at Per Scholas, a nonprofit social venture that provides free IT job training and career opportunities for low­income individuals, as Corporate Relations and Volunteer Manager in 2013. In this role, she was tasked with creating and implementing a structured volunteer program aimed at engaging corporations and industry professionals in assisting Per Scholas students. Since then, Sarah has grown the program to include over 50 industry partners who donate their time. In her current role, Sarah continues to manage and grow the volunteer program and is also responsible for creating and maintaining employer relationships.

Annie Scurfield, Agribusiness Project Manager, The Earth Institute
A participant of the GlaxoSmithKline PULSE Volunteer Partnership, a skills­based volunteering initiative that matches GSK employees to partner nonprofits for three or six months, Annie is currently working full­time on the Millennium Villages Project at the Earth Institute. In this role, she helps scale the piloted Agribusiness program, assesses agricultural extension service needs, summarizes best management practices of soil nutrients for priority crops, advises on data collection, and improves the design of the Lead Farmer Program. In addition to promoting CVM products and covering key hospital
accounts at GSK, she has mentored new representatives through the training process and led an initiative to merge the planning activities of former Glaxo Wellcome and Smith Kline Beecham employees.

Kim Gillman, Senior Consultant, Advisory Services, Taproot Foundation
Kim comes to The Taproot Foundation, a nonprofit organization that engages
professionals in pro bono service, with a background in non­profit management,
organizational development, and a deep commitment to social change. She partners with companies to design, implement, and scale high­quality pro bono initiatives that maximize each company’s unique skills and expertise. Prior to Taproot, Kim worked as the Individual Giving Manager at City Year New York, a non­profit organization focused on keeping students in school and on the track to success.

Ali Marano, Head of CAO Talent Pipeline, J.P. Morgan Chase
As the head of the Chief Administrative Office Talent Pipeline at J.P. Morgan Chase, Ali focuses on identifying, attracting, and engaging talent to meet the diversity and innovation needs of the CAO through the execution of traditional, alternative, and social good programs. Her group has three targeted pillars: University Engagement, which identifies the CAO’s critical university relationships and identifies talent while building the J.P. Morgan Chase brand; Pipeline Programs, which focus on increasing and diversifying the talent pipeline via early identification, talent acquisition enhancements, and exploration of new talent sources; and CAO Social Good Programs, aimed at attracting and engaging existing and prospective employees through innovative programs that support social good organizations and youth skill development.


This event is hosted in partnership with Net Impact NYC. NINYC is the New York City Professional chapter of Net Impact, a global community of 60,000+ leaders who are committed to changing the world through business. The Net Impact New York City Professional Chapter (NINYC) activates a network of professionals to leverage the marketplace for sustainable social & environmental change. We do this by connecting the right people, knowledge sharing and inspiring positive change. For more information, please visit netimpactnyc.org.

results.description:
Learn How to Get out of the Rat Race! 

Cashflow 101 is a fun way to learn the basic concepts of Real estate Investing. Your objective throughout the night will be to get out of the rat race and into the fast track! In other words you have to find a way to get out of that 9-5 that we all dislike and step into the life you always wanted to live.

How do you get out of the race race you ask?

Your total monthly passive income has to be higher than your total monthly expenses.

Cashflow 101 is an educational tool in board game format which aims to teach the players concepts of investing by having their money work for them in a risk free setting (play money) while simultaneously increasing financial literacy and stressing the imperative nature of accountability.


There are two stages to the game. In the first, "the rat race", the player aims to raise his or her character's passive income level to where it exceeds the character's expenses. The winner is determined in the second stage, "the fast track". To win, a player must get his or her character to buy their "dream" or accumulate an additional $50,000 in monthly cash flow.

In place of “score cards”, there are financial statements. The game requires the players to fill out their own financial statements so that they can see more clearly what is happening with their money. It generally shows how assets generate income and demonstrates that liabilities and 'doodads' are expenses.
results.name: Cashflow 101- learn how to get out of the rat race in real life!

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 6:30PM - 8:30PM

This month's host: devbootcamp

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

Book Launch & Author Talk: Jeanne-Marie Gescher‘s All Under Heaven
Tuesday, November 17, 2015 | 6:30PM – 8:00PM

FREE

China Institute is delighted to announce an evening with Jeanne-Marie Gescher. Is China’s greatest importance to the world really its economics?

In her new book, Jeanne-Marie Gescher argues that China’s greatest importance lies in a 5,000 year question about order: how can human beings live together in a big and complex world?

Weaving together the inspirations, ideas and dreams that have shaped the way China’s people have thought about order from the ancient past to the recent present, Jeanne-Marie explains how and why China’s question is at the heart of everything, not only in China but for the world at large.

Through an evening of readings and conversation, Jeanne-Marie will share the ideas of her book: All Under Heaven, China’s Dreams of Order (all-under-heaven.com).

Learn more and register: Click Here

results.description:
Philippe Leefsma, developer-evangelist at Autodesk, will show a few examples of 3D on the web and take you through an extensive demo of the Autodesk View & Data API, a WebGL-based technology that enables your website users to visualize and interact with stunning high-fidelity 3D & 2D models in a browser or on a mobile device anytime, anywhere. The demo will include how to get started very quickly with the technology to add 3D to your own website and a presentation of the existing Node.js samples that we created (https://developer-autodesk.github.io). We will cover View & Data API workflows from a technical perspective targeted to Node developers using custom npm packages and tools we created to alleviate common tasks such as uploading large files, model translation, storage, and a taste of the coolest client-side JavaScript samples that we have so far.

About the Speaker

Philippe has a master's degree in Computer Sciences and Software Engineering. He carried his studies in Paris at I.S.E.P and in USA, at Colorado School of Mines. He joined Autodesk 8 years ago where he works as developer-evangelist within the Autodesk Developer Network. He was supporting various desktop products APIs such as AutoCAD®, AutoCAD Mechanical®, and Autodesk® Inventor®. He is nowadays focusing on Cloud and Mobile technologies and share his experience through a devblog: htpp://adndevblog.typepad.com/cloud_and_mobile. He enjoys travelling and meet developers from around the world to work with them on challenging programming  topics.

Join us for a book review of the AMORC book The Technique of the Disciple by Raymund Andrea.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 4: The Neophyte and Initiative.

You can download the book free here!

About the Book

The Technique of the Disciple is a book containing a modem description of the ancient esoteric path to spiritual illumination, trod by the masters and avatars of yore. It has long been said that Christ left, as a great heritage to members of His secret council, a private method for guidance in life, which method has been preserved until today in the secret, occult, mystery schools.

In this book, Raymund Andrea has created a masterful account of the challenges and rewards awaiting those who dare to venture on the ancient path to mystical awakening. He reveals the method for attaining a greater life taught in these mystery schools, which perhaps parallels the secret instructions of Christ to members of His council.

All are Welcome!

This week I am going to see The 33 I will arrive at 6:45 for the 7:20 pm showing. I  have seat D6 If you are coming post your seat # 


Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it. 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
CASA GRANDE Directed by Fellipe Barbosa
Opens November 13, 2015, at Cinema Village in NYC.
November 16, 17, 18 & 19 - Special Discount price available for Meetup Members Purchase $8 Senoir Ticket online or at Box Office and give code "Brazilian Film Series"when picking up tickets Coming-of-age as a rude awakening: one high school senior’s dawning sexuality is shadowed by the discovery of his upper-class family’s looming financial ruin. Polished and penetrating, Casa Grande renders a sharp social canvas of contemporary Brazil through the eyes of young Jean (Thales Cavalcanti), who struggles with newfound knowledge of his racial and class privilege even as his parents, a failed hedge-fund baron and his sheltered wife, grasp at straws merely to survive. An international audience favorite, Casa Grande has stirred lively, searching discussion among Brazilians of the often repressed realities of stubborn racial bias and stark income inequality.

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

Current Roster:

Liz

Joseph

Mike

Alden
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

results.description:
Interested in out-of-body experiences and psychic experiences? Your welcome to join us at one of free public seminars!

Have you ever had a vivid flying dream? How about the sensation of floating while falling asleep or meditating? How about the perception of “dropping” back into your body just before waking up? If so it may be possible that you have experienced what is called an out-of-body experience. It has sometimes been known in various spiritual traditions and schools of thought in history, as “astral projection” or “soul travel”.

Despite being considered by many to be a strange or obscure topic, the experience has been reported for thousands of years by people all over the world, often mixed up with dreams. Throughout history people have reported “otherworldly” journeys and spiritual experiences into other dimensions in a variety of settings - during spiritual practices (i.e meditation, prayer, etc), near-death, during sleep or spontaneously during the day. What is interesting is that unbeknownst to most of the public, is that the out-of-body experience is a powerful tool for self-transformation, self-discovery and wellness and can be willfully induced, developed, controlled and utilized to greatly benefit yourself and others. The experience is much like the altered states of consciousness that shamans and medicine men in history used to connect with the psychic world, obtain knowledge, heal others, etc.

This short seminar is offered freely to the public and will provide you with cutting edge information on out-of-body experiences (i.e. astral projection, soul travel, etc), subtle energy, non-physical dimensions and related topics. Cutting through misconceptions and misinformation about the topic, you will learn about the latest research on these experiences, including their benefits (see below) and – unbeknownst to most of us – how they already affect our daily life yet have huge implications about who you are and your life purpose.
Some of the benefits of the out-of-body experience are:

• Understanding non-physical dimensions or realities
• Direct contact with spirit guides
• Development of psychic abilities
• Losing the fear of death
• Getting information about your life purpose
• Using OBEs as a tool to assist or heal others
• Psychic awareness and protection
• Development of universalism and fraternity

In addition to these benefits, these additional fascinating topics will be discussed at the lecture:

• Our multidimensional nature
• How the OBE experience (i.e astral projection, etc) works
• How an OBE is experienced first hand
• Astral projection tips, benefits & utilities
• How to use the OBE to discover our life purpose
• Psychic abilities related to the OBE
• Our multiple subtle bodies and their function
• What current research tells us about the OBE
• Overview of easy out-of-body experience techniques
• Non physical dimensions
• What happens psychically at night
• Information about IAC’s OBE and psychic training programs
• Answers to questions you have about these topics or your experiences

Is this lecture right for you?

This lecture is packed with fascinating information and is interesting to both those new to the topic, or those already quite knowledgeable about it. Whether you’re just curious about the topic, want to ask about an experience you had, or what to go deeper, this lecture is for you. It is well suited for anyone planning on further study but still looking for a rational, integrated overview of these frequently misunderstood topics.

If you are interested in IAC’s other programs, note that this free lecture is an ideal (although optional) starting point for people interested in taking IAC’s other courses. It allows would-be students to make a personal connection with our instructors and team, obtaining confidence in our knowledge, approach, and framework. This lecture also introduces our organization, and gives an overview of our curriculum, programs, and publications. Hence it is a great opportunity to ask an instructor about IAC's main OBE training course, the award-winning Consciousness Development Program (CDP), which we offer regularly in New York.

Who teaches this free lecture? 

It is taught by one of IAC’s senior faculty members, depending on who’s available. IAC’s faculty members have years of experience and training in spirituality and consciousness studies, including out-of-body experiences and psychic phenomena. IAC is an educational and research centered organization in the area of consciousness studies, human potential and psychic development, and has offices in over 12 countries worldwide.

How do I attend?

Confirm via meetup that you're attending or email us to register at newyork (-at-) iacworld.org
results.name: Free Seminar on Out-of-Body Experiences and Consciousness Studies

results.description:
Bruichladdich, how the hell do you even pronounce that. I was always told like "brook-laddy."  This is the tasting event you've been waiting for.  Bruichladdich has become really popular and a go to Islay scotch for whisky drinkers.  There are basically 3 types of "laddie": the Bruichladdich scotches are unpeated, the Port Charlotte scotches are heavily peated, and the Octomore has been designated the "most heavily peated whisky in the world."  Basically, the Kilchoman tasting was a warm up for the main event.  This event will be packed, get there early or you might not fit in the bar. 

The Logistics:  The complimentary  tasting is at 8pm at Caledonia.  I will get there likely really early because I now work nearby!  This bar is small so I'm putting a limit on the group. I'm going to try to grab the only table up front but be warned, if you want a seat, come early, this place gets packed on tasting nights. Closest (and only) subway stop is the 86th St. 4,5,6 stop and then walk over to 2nd Ave and down to 84 St.
results.name: Bruichladdich Tasting

results.description:
This meeting will be on Tuesday evening, not Wednesday. The fee is $10 and you can bring a friend for free! 

To pay, go here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wise-women-waking-tickets-19237072602

Welcome to a wonderful group of creative, passionate, and purposeful midlife women who are committed to living a life of meaning and contribution.


Please join us for a warm and stimulating gathering of inspired Wise Women as we explore questions like:
What is calling you?
How do you recognize this calling?
How far are you in your expression of it?
What is stopping you?
Who do you believe yourself to be that may be limited or not limited?
Who do you want to be or to become? 

Why is midlife (or later) the perfect time to recreate yourself and step into the highest expression of your soul? 
Why is this moment in history such a powerful call to be all we can be? 
How do you relate to the unknown, to being in a process of discovery?
What is it that you feel called to serve - in other people, in the world?
What do you feel most passionate about, what is your Big Why?
How can we all balance the call of our soul and the world with the practical necessities of life?
How is the world transforming and how are you a part of that, contributing to positive change?
What is your version of Heaven on Earth and how do you see yourself contributing to that? 
How can we clear the inner fears, doubts, limiting beliefs and stories we tell ourselves that keep us disempowered - so that we can be the powerful limitless beings we truly are? 
How have all the experiences of your life led up to this moment, so that you can make your contribution? 
What are the steps to becoming fully empowered women, contributing to the resurgence of the Sacred Feminine in the world? 
What is your unique role in the global transformation, that can bring you personal fulfillment while it helps others?
results.name: New York Wise Women Waking

results.description: So much going on at the gym these days! Our membership continues to grow as we all are as actors, directors, writers and preformers! We are both welcoming new faces to our weekly creative laboratory as well as developing a lovely relationship with our dedicated regulars. The format is simple, we all meet at our host Yeoryia Studios, (where we split the studio fee at $5 each), sign up to preform in front of the group then give each other feedback and suggestions in an encouraging way. The projects brought in have included, (but definitely not limited to), monologues, scenes, audition and casting prep, experimental pieces, class work, commercial work, written scripts in progress, film and reel screenings. If you aren't currently working on something, come anyway! There is always someone who could use a partner and we always bring our hand bag of scenes and scripts for just such occasions!  Subjects ranging from classical to experimental to improvised. Traditions and ways of working also run the gammet from method to intuitive and free style! We are proudly a non judgemental, open minded group where are uniqueness and background is honored in itself and also as it enriches the group and performances as a whole. Hope to see you at the next gym!
results.name: Stickin to the gym like an addict!

results.description:
After developing a number of websites, you will eventually build up a toolbox of code that you use on most projects.  This toolbox lets you develop faster and better as you have access to code that you regularly use and trust.

At this month’s meetup I’d like us to share some of the tools we use for developing WordPress websites. Some things you can share are:

• A Base plugin you install on every site.

• Custom PHP functions.

• Custom CSS styles.

• PHP library you include.

The goal is for each of us to leave the meetup with a new tool for our toolbox.

Sharing is not mandatory.


PRESENTED BY: STEVE BRUNER


OPENING PRESENTATION: Using Vagrant with Managed Hosts

We will be discussing Vagrant development environments for WordPress and how these tools can help us build sites faster and more efficiently. A specific focus of this talk will be on Managed WordPress Hosting and how this platform affects our development workflow. The presentation will compare several WordPress Vagrant environments including the new Basic WordPress Vagrant project Joe's been developing for Ideas On Purpose.

PRESENTED BY: JOE MALLER


ABOUT THE SPEAKERS:

Steve Bruner is the CEO of SlipFire, a New York City based WordPress development studio, and a partner in Piklist where he is creating the most powerful framework available for WordPress.


Joe Maller is CTO at Ideas On Purpose, an NYC design firm. Obsessive about process, Joe will happily spend a week building automated workflows to save 10 minutes of repetitive work. This isn't always the best decision. Joe has been using WordPress since mid-2005 and is very tall.
results.name: Building Your Developer Toolbox

Bring a project and get to work, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
Elizabeth Freedman will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest! 

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Nov 2015 Meet Up of the  Expert Topics series presents :

"The effect of the new Crowdfunding rules on Marketplace and P2P Lending"



New Location :

FAQ (on the new SEC rules)


•Can you create a large number of special purpose vehicles that sell to the general public $1mil of loans without any registration ?

• Loan backed securities...are securities ?

•  Effect of easy to get public financing for startups ?

• Effect on valuations ?

• Effect on the angel rounds ?

• Effect of Fraud ?

• Why were these SEC rules put in place in 1933 anyway ? 

• How does this compare to the 2001 VC bubble ?

Hosted by George Popescu , together with our co-sponsors: 


Rise New York (http://www.thinkrise.com/ ), a beautiful collaborative coworking community.

Backed (http://www.districtcowork.com/ ), a revolutionary fin-tech company which allows Millennials to use their parent's credit score to get started in their financial life.

Down the Road Brewery ( http://downtheroadbrewery.com/ ), a Boston based craft beer brewery making traditional European beer with generous flavors.

Agenda :

• 30 minutes of networking 

• followed by 3 talks (10min talk, 10 min Q&A)

Confirmed speakers to date:

Greg Nowak,Partner Pepper Hamilton,"Legal aspects of the new SEC crowdfunding rules " 

George Popescu, CEO, Backed , " Loopholes and strategies to use the new SEC crowdfunding rules".


Peter Einstein,Co-Founder / Chief Visionary Officer, The CrowdFunding Network, "How the Recent SEC Rules on Equity Crowdfunding & Mini-IPOs Will Create a Pipeline of Qualified Business Borrowers" 


• followed by a final 30 minutes of informal networking and discussions 

--------------

Bios of speakers 

George A. Popescu sold and exited Boston Technologies (BT) in 2014. BT is a fin-tech company in the currencies over-the-counter space. George was the Founder and CEO and boot-strapped it from $0 to a $20+ million business without any equity investment. BT has been #1 fastest growing company in Boston in 2011 and on the Inc. 500/5000 list  4 years in a row. BT was acquired by  Currency Mountain in 2014.

Presently George is the co-CEO and co-founder of Backed , an online lending marketplace focused on co-signed personal unsecured loans. Simultaneously he is CEO of Down the Road Brewery, a craft beer brewery in Boston and Partner in LunaCap Ventures, a VC fund focused on venture debt to young companies with at least $100k in revenue. He is also President of Journal of Cellular and Molecular Medicine, a peer reviewed scientific journal with impact factor 5


Gregory J. Nowak is a partner in the Philadelphia office of Pepper Hamilton LLP and a practice leader for hedge funds in the firm’s Funds Services Practice Group. He concentrates his practice in securities law, particularly in representing investment management companies and other clients on matters arising under the Investment Company Act of 1940 and the related Investment Advisers Act of 1940. Mr. Nowak also handles mergers and acquisitions, corporate and regulated investment company tax work and other corporate matters. He also represents broker-dealers and CTAs and CPOs with respect to matters under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Commodity Exchange Act.

Peter M. Einstein is Co-founder / President / Chief Visionary Officer of The CrowdFunding Network, Inc. (parent company of CF4ALL.com & LaunchIPO.com). A socially-responsible entrepreneur and investor, he is a former award-winning advertising Creative Director / Copywriter credited with launching a number of iconic products and campaigns, including the first cellphone and cellular service in the U.S. His latest venture, LaunchIPO.com, is the "Crowd-Powered Mini-IPO LaunchPad" for companies seeking to use the SEC's Regulation A+ to raise up to $50 million per year.

------------------------------

The location : 

Rise New York is a collaborative co­working community shaping the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co­create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a world­class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars. Oh, and we leave the front door open for the curious…

results.description:
** This is the Club Annual  Meeting and  club officer elections will take place **

The New York City Sea Gypsies 

Present

“Exploring the Long Island Sound” 

By Captain Denis Habza of Squalus Marine Divers 

Description:

You ever wondered  if there is anything to dive in the Long Island Sound?  What is the visibility is like, any shipwrecks?  How deep it is.  Captain Denis Habza has explored it and will be telling us all about it.  First, he will be giving us first a  very brief introduction to Squalus Marine, what they do and why they do it.  Then, there will be  an interactive presentation with opportunities to explore various aspects of The Long Island Sound.  There will be a short video and an item that illustrates the benefits of exploring where most only a few dare to do.

About the Speaker:

Captain Denis Habza Founder of Squalus Marine Divers (squalusmarine.com), an online video program that offers divers (and non divers) a chance to explore and dive virtually. Captain Denis, has been diving for over 10 years and has logged over 550 dives, almost exclusively in The Long Island Sound. Piloting his second dive vessel SQUALUS II, Habza explores The Sound and hopes to show its viability as a dive destination. After filming for 4 years he has compiled multiple video documentations of wrecks previously unrecorded for the public to explore. Squalus Marine Divers will continue to film in 2016 and plans on branching out to more "off the beaten path" locations.

results.description:
What's in a Character?

This is the first of two workshops that will focus on character work. You will learn techniques that will enable you to discover the voice, body, emotional life and history of a character with ease. You will learn to "get out of the way" of the character so you can discover, rather than contrive, who the character is.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.


Suggested Donation: $15* 

*free drink with $15 donation

*most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more. 

_____________________________________________________________________

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.

Presenters:  Isabel Dassinger and Antonio Merlo


In life, some changes can happen in a second, and others may take a lifetime.  Whenever change happens, and we find ourselves in a new “frame of mind,” we are able to create the changes we want to bring to our lives.  Out with the old … in with the new.

In this meditation you will be guided to orchestrate the changes …  be supplied with the information you need  by your inner guides.  You will see clues, gain awareness, and then shift.  Knowledge is a powerful tool and when it comes from within it becomes your own personal guide.  That is when it is most effective.  Trust and faith are gained here.

Enjoy this journey as Antonio creates a safe, sacred space for easy transition.  Please bring a journal or note paper to record the experience for your own review. 

$12 per person--Prepayment preferred please!

We will be meeting at Info Commons in room# 214 (go to your left  after entering main library entrance and  take escalator up to second floor).

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

David

Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
“Life is about the people you meet and the things you create with them”

-- Holstee

Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change, on Tuesday, November 17th for Networking with Purpose - Grow Your Career & Impact Through Authentic Relationship Building (learn more about Marcos here).

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCNetworkingNov17

===========================================

Are you looking for a more fulfilling job, thinking about a career change, launching a new business, or wanting to attract new business or clients? If so, one of the most critical factors to your success is building a strong and diverse network. The foundation for every job and business is engaging and building relationships with people, and networking can be the single most powerful tool you can use for accelerating your career or business, growing your impact as well as increasing happiness in your work.

In today’s rapidly-changing, hyper-competitive working world, networking is vital to creating new career and business opportunities. In fact, over 70% of jobs are found through networking and 40% of job seekers say they found their dream job though a personal connection. For entrepreneurs, a strong network is a key source for new clients, partnerships, and advice.

However, most people don’t like to “network” and often feel uncomfortable doing it. This is because the common form of networking - going to events, swapping business cards, and gathering meaningless LinkedIn connections - simply doesn't work. We need a form of networking that focuses on meaningful connections and strategic relationship building. This is what Networking with Purpose is all about.

In Networking with Purpose, Marcos Salazar will share strategies, techniques, and lessons learned in building a diverse network of thousands of professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives from every background and industry to grow Be Social Change into the largest social impact community in New York City. Marcos will show you how to build enduring, mutually beneficial relationships by providing value to others and sharing your authentic self.

**SPACE IS LIMITED**

*Doors open at 6:45 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp*

In this course, you will learn how to connect with really successful people and how to leverage your network to grow your business or advance your career 

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• How to build your networking in a purposeful, authentic, and meaningful way - while having some fun during the process!

• Develop the mindset and strategies for meeting and building authentic and mutually beneficial relationships

• How to connect with and maintain relationships with busy people

• Strategies for leveraging LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook for building your network

• Networking mistakes to avoid

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Professionals looking to create new career and business opportunities

• People seeking a new job or looking to make a career shift

• Entrepreneurs wanting to increase sales, build new partnerships, and seek advice

• Creatives and service providers (consultants, coaches, agents, and speakers) wanting to attract new clients and business opportunities

• Students or recent grads looking to build a foundation for their future career path


 INSTRUCTOR BIO

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.   


SPACE PARTNER  

The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

<a href="http://www.wework.com/"></a>

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.

results.description:
CABALITO GOES VEGAN!

Join us for our second officially #veganized restaurant outing on Tuesday November 17th!!!

This time we are heading to China Town to a small Salvadorian Cafe that is completely on board with #Veganizing. The cafe is small so there is only room for 40 from 7-9pm...However, you could always get takeout and enjoy your meal at the park across the street!

Owner, Randy and his girlfriend are very interested in going vegan for the animals and the environment but weren't sure how to make it happen with their business. Not only are they interested in being vegan for the day, but they are seriously considering making the switch to vegan a permanent thing with our help.

Veganizer NYC will be working with Randy to teach him how he can make vegan cheeses and plant-based meats in the days before the meetup and Tuesday will be a day of taste testing :)

CABALITO GOES VEGAN!

Join us for our second officially #veganized restaurant outing on Tuesday November 17th (Just two weeks away)!!!


This time we are heading to China Town to a small Salvadorian Cafe that is completely on board with #Veganizing. 


The cafe is small so there is only room for 40 from 7-9pm...However, you could always get takeout and enjoy your meal at the park across the street!

Owner, Randy and his girlfriend are very interested in going vegan for the animals and the environment but weren't sure how to make it happen with their business. 

Not only are they interested in being vegan for the day, but they are seriously considering making the switch to vegan a permanent thing with our help.

Ricky (My GustOrganics chef) and I will be working with Randy to teach him how he can make vegan cheeses and plant-based meats in the days before the meetup and Tuesday will be a day of taste testing :)

results.description:
National Women's Liberation is hosting a discussion on #ShoutYourAbortion in NYC and the history of abortion speak-outs in the US.


The #ShoutYourAbortion campaign that began in Seattle is spreading to the East Coast - come to our November meeting to learn more. We'll also read and discuss a short article from the Redstockings Archives on the largely hidden history of how women won abortion in the U.S.: not because Supreme Court justices were nice to us, but through speak outs, disruptions, and bold demands of women's liberation organizers in NYC and beyond in the late 1960s.

Tues 11/17from 7-9pm @ The Commons in Brooklyn, 388 Atlantic Avenue


This event is for women only. Thank you.


NWL's priorities are abortion/birth control, overthrowing the double day, and feminist consciousness raising. Our Women of Color Caucus (WOCC) meets separately from white women to better understand how white supremacy intersects with other forms of oppression. We also work closely with Redstockings on "History for Activist Use". Email [masked].
results.name: Learn about #ShoutYourAbortion & the history of abortion speakouts

results.description:
MEETUP AGENDA 


7:00pm - Featured Presentation


Jeff Falkowski - The Importance of the Meteor Community


"Having a large e-commerce site developed as a non technical person and how with the help of Meteor and the Meteor community it finally got done." This talk will include the thinking behind platform selection; finding and evaluating developers; deciding on packages and other resources used in GearPlan; the challenges faced along the way; and how the Meteor community helped it along.


Except the first 5 years, Jeff Falkowski has been a musician his whole life. He's the founder of Gear Plan, an all-Meteor application described as "the Airbnb for musical gear." Follow him at @gearplan and  jefffalkowski.com 


Tom Goldenberg - Building Multi Platform Native Apps with Meteor


"In the mobile-first world, how can a company speed up the feedback loop by developing native, real-time products on web, Android, and iOS? I believe the potential answer is Meteor and React Native. I will demonstrate how in one week I developed native prototypes for all 3 platforms using basically the same code, but with native feel and response."

Tom is a Meteor and React Native developer, currently available for hire. His background is in foreign language instruction, and lived for 9 years in South India. You can reach Tom at[masked] or on Github as tgoldenberg.


8:00pm - Break

8:15pm - Lightning Talks & Demos

8:45pm - Announcements

9:00pm - Broome Street Bar

We'll head out afterwards to the Broome Street Bar at 363 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013 (between Grand & Leonard Streets)

Got an idea for a keynote presentation or lightning talk?  Sign up using our Speaker Form. We're looking for tutorials, walkthroughs, talks, discussion topics, and production apps about or related to Meteor.


If there's a topic you'd like someone to talk about, post that too!

And don't worry, you're not required to get technical.  Meteor is new, and we're learning together.

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Tuesday, November 17 from 7 PM to 9:00PM for Developing Surveys that Measure Nonprofit's Impact with Amanda Babine, Director of Evaluate for Change and Aliana H Piñeiro, Evaluation Trainer at Evaluate for Change.

In order to obtain usable data you must ensure you are asking the right questions. Having the right measurement tools is key to capturing the right data. Participants will learn how to create a reliable and valid measurement tool. We will review best practices such as increasing response rate, making questions age-appropriate and online tools. This training is ideal for individuals who desire to learn how to develop sound measurement tools.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BCSSurveyNov17

===========================================


WHAT YOU’LL LEARN:

• How to plan a survey project using a strategic approach

• Understand and avoid the common pitfalls when developing a survey or another type of measurement tool

• How to build a survey to measure change, growth and overall impact


WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR:

• Social sector professionals including but not limited to: nonprofit & foundation staff, governmental workers, and social enterprise change makers.

• Individuals looking to use data to inform their practice and make the world a better place

INSTRUCTOR BIOS

</a>

Amanda Babine, Director, Evaluate for Change

Amanda is the Director of Evaluate for Change (@Evaluate4Change), a program evaluation training company that teaches social sector professional how to measure their impact. She has worked in the nonprofit field in both a direct practice and research capacity. Before directing Evaluate for Change, she has evaluated large citywide programs working at Columbia University and the City University of New York (CUNY). Before transitioning into a more quantitative role, she worked at the Center for the Study of Social Policy developing a youth well-being framework while conducting Participatory Action Research (PAR) with marginalized communities throughout New York City. Amanda holds a Master's Degree in Public Policy and Social Work from Columbia University.

results.description:
Autolifts takes advantage of Scala’s advanced type system to yield a set of abstractions for working with complex objects. We’ll introduce the concept of lifting and why you might want to incorporate this pattern in your code. Then we’ll show how the library takes that concept, mixes it with dependent types and implicit extensions to automatically lift in a type safe manner. Finally, we’ll show how using these extensions simplifies code, reducing boilerplate while making code more easily understood and maintained.

Owein Reese has been a full-time Scala developer for over five years and has spoken at several Scala meetups and conferences. He has several open source projects and leads several engineering teams at Media Math.
results.name: Autolifts: Automatic Type-Derived Lifting by Owein Reese

results.description:
How often do we take the time to slow down, tune in to what our body needs, massage and stretch our muscles?

We live in a culture that values always being in action, either at our computer or at the gym (or even the yoga studio!).

But taking the time to stretch is just as important, both for its physical benefits as well as its psychological, emotional and spiritual ones.

It improves our range of motion, while also stretching our range of emotion.

- Release tightness and tension from your muscles
- Improve flexibility and circulation
- Relieve lower back pain
- Stress relief
- Deeper breathing, which leads to feelings of spaciousness and well-being
- Reconnecting with the body, leaving us feeling more whole, aware and capable of dealing with life's challenges
- Release 'happy' hormones
- Connect with the senses, sensuality and release shame around our body

We will start with a guided meditation, followed by deep breathing and slow stretching.

Please bring a yoga mat, a pen and journal, and dress comfortably.

See you on the mat!

Love always,

Melody

Sensual Meditative Stretching: Release Stress and Befriend Your Body

Tuesday November 3, 7-8 pm

64 W 3rd Street, 2nd floor, Room 5
New York, NY

$10 donation

Register

NOTE: in order to cover costs, this meetup requires at least 5 people to be signed up 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully and purchase your ticket so I know what size room to book for us in advance.

----------------------------
ABOUT MELODY KIERSZ
Melody Kiersz holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

Find out more at nakedwellness.com
results.name: Sensual Meditative Stretching: Release Stress and Befriend Your Body

results.description:
WritersAnonymous is a writers social support group in New York City that was formally located in Boston, MA. When the group was in Boston, the members all pledged to write something ambitious and potentially life changing, and that was such a rewarding experience. We even wrote and published a book called "Seven At The Sevens," which is for sale on WritersAnonymous.org and Amazon. Also, if you do a Google search for "Seven At The Sevens," it's the first item that pops up! While there, you can also find our NPR interview about the book. Although we ended up publishing a book, the group’s main mission was about keeping each other’s writing going and on track, and holding each writer accountable to his/her own self-imposed but ambitious goals. The main purpose of WritersAnonymous.org was not about publishing a book or to have each other’s writings critiqued, although that can and did happen.

Further, WritersAnonymous is about being inspired by your peers and inspiring others to find their own voices. It is about connecting with people who have a similar passion in life and who may understand you a little better because they have the same burning desire to tell a story in whatever written form it may emerge. It is also about forging new and lasting friendships in a supportive and encouraging environment during the often lonely and difficult creative writing process.

So, want to write and create something worthwhile, and also equally help others in their literary journeys? If so, join the group and let's begin!
results.name: WritersAnonymous NYC
