As an agent you only have so much time in the day and finding quality investment opportunities for your investors can prove to be a challenge. You may have your local investors who ask you about investing in markets outside your area of expertise and you are unclear on how to uncover investment opportunities for them. This can be an opportunity lost or you lose control of your clients by passing them on to a local agent for a small referral fee.

Strongbrook Real Estate is offering a new program for licensed brokers and agents who specialize in working with real estate investors. In your personal network do you work with investors who want deals with built in equity or deals with positive cash-flow income? Are you looking for opportunities to bring to your local investors in markets outside of your area of expertise?

By becoming an Approved Agent or Broker you will be able to leverage Strongbrook’s Real Estate''s Investment Organization’s size and negotiating power as a group to bring your personal network of investors better deals, in markets all around the country and earn referral and marketing fees equivalent to full cooperating commissions.

We have THE solution! Expands your reach for property inventory into the best markets in the nation, and transforms your idle client database into active real estate investors. Leverage the expertise, relationships, and infrastructure of Strongbrook’s entire professional team whose focus is:

 1) Training new and existing real estate investors how to create a custom game plan for retirement by conservatively purchasing cash flowing properties in the best markets.

2) Providing investors “ready-to-buy” properties.

3) Assisting investors in managing and maintaining monthly cash flow and profit. Strongbrook does all of this for you! Your clients will receive the best service and a carefully crafted step-by-step process for real estate investing success.

results.description:
Come join us at our November meeting where we will feature the following presentations:

Bruce Mittelman will give a live demonstration of the Apple TV 4. The new Apple TV delivers an all-new experience with a touch enabled remote, Siri, powerful new hardware, and great content, games, and more on the App Store.

Bruce will also give a demonstration of the iPad Pro, Apple's new 12.9-inch addition to the iPad line.

George Ajjan will give a short tutorial on using the latest version of the iMovie application for browsing, editing, and sharing your clips and movies.

Jerry Glacken will give another installment of his Macintosh Basics presentations. This month he'll focus on the Mac OS X directory structure and the Finder.

Louis Perez will conduct a smartphone shootout between the Samsung Galaxy S6 and the Apple iPhone 6S. If you're in the market for a new phone, you won't want to miss this overview of all of the pluses and minuses for these models.

Plus we'll discuss all of the latest Apple news and have our "Question & Answer" session where our experts will try to solve your problems.

As always, a meeting you won't want to miss! Hope to see you all there!


About NJMUG:

The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (NJMUG) is open to all persons, whether they are a current or future Macintosh user. An individual membership in NJMUG costs $30.00 per year. If you are thinking of becoming an NJMUG member but would like to check the group out first, we allow non-members to attend two meetings as a "guest". Once you become a member of NJMUG you are entitled to attend all monthly meetings as well as gain access to all of the member benefits including member discounts on hardware and software, free USB flash drive, monthly distribution files, and eligibility in all raffles and member giveaways.  Check www.njmug.org for more information.

The places we grow up can have a huge impact on who we become as adults. How signing up works: First come first serve

The Place: While bringing easy access to authentic Shanghai street foods, Yaso Tangbao inherits the legacy of Nanxiang soup dumpling and promulgates the marvel of the Oriental culture — it’s where food, history and culture come together.

I've heard very good things about this place and been told by people from Shanghai that it's very authentic.

Menu: http://www.yasotangbao.com/menu.html

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

The NYC Atheists’ Advanced Writers Group, now going for two years, is open to talented writers who want the support and camaraderie of other secular writers in polishing their work and getting happily published.  Our group meets once a month; we gently critique each other’s work, but our main focus is on helping each other get published. There is no charge for this workshop; we ask only that you commit to meeting once a month, reading the work of the other members and offering your suggestions for improvement in an upbeat, encouraging manner.

What do we mean by “advanced writers?”

We mean those writers who are close to being published or have already been published in some form. We also mean writers who, we can see by reading samples of their writing, have great potential but until now have not been mentored or encouraged to treat their work seriously or to aim for publication.

How do you know if you fit our criteria for a writer with promise?

You don’t.  Writers are often poor judges of the level of their talent. We suggest that you give us the opportunity to judge that, because we can often sense that spark of talent even if you yourself do not.  Additionally, we have recently instituted a new member category, dubbed “Apprentice author”--individuals who demonstrate potential but who have not yet been published anywhere or achieved commercial capability.

Submit a Sample

If you are interested in joining this kind of a close and involved group of writers, submit a sample of your writing (15 pages or less) to the group,plus a personal letter telling us a little about your background, what you are aiming for and what you think we can do for you. Your sample submission may be a play, fiction or non-fiction. If fiction, it can be a short story or a chapter of a book.  If non-fiction, the sample can be an article or a chapter of a non-fiction book. If a play, send only Act One.

If you are accepted into the group, we ask only that you encourage and support each group member by reading his or her material, critiquing it in a kindly, professional manner and attend our monthly meeting to discuss it in a group setting. There is no charge whatsoever for membership in the Advanced Writers Group.  Our goal is to encourage more good secular writers to enter the literary marketplace.

Bear in mind that once you are accepted, everyone in the group accepts that you are headed for publication; this is not a “learn to write” group. This is a group whose members have shown themselves to have solid skills and need only minimum critiquing or, more importantly, encouragement in tackling the publishing industry, which, when done alone, can be discouraging. We are there as friends, as your cheerleaders, your mentors, your colleagues.

Jane Everhart, Facilitator  NYCA Advanced Writers Group

NYC ATHEISTS CONTACT: [masked]

TO APPLY, PLEASE SEND A SAMPLE OF YOUR WRITING (15 pages or less) plus a brief bio and a letter telling us what you think we can do for you, to:

NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group                                                                                                c/o NYC Atheists Inc.                                                                                                                        Box 6060 NY, NY[masked]

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Requesting a Refund

24 Hours Cancellation Policy

results.description:
(See below for links to excerpts for a preview of the book.)


The National Book Award Finalists were announced yesterday. I scheduled this Meetup, in anticipation, because I thought it would be fun to read one of them. The track record of the winner of the NBA winning the Pulitzer isn't great, in fact finalists who do not win have one more times, including last year's Pulitzer winner. Still, the NBA often chooses good books as finalists.


I was conflicted on whether to discuss Adam Johnson's story collection, FORTUNE SMILES, or Lauren Groff's novel.
I'd love to discuss a collection, at some point, but from all the buzz Groff's novel is getting, I think it's the front runner.

If you are interested in a preview of the novel, you can read an excerpt in the New Yorker, as well as another one from the Atlantic. Both should be available for free.  


The Meetup is a day before the announcement of the winner. Perhaps we'll be one step ahead of the judges. If we're not, then maybe we'll read the winner in December!

Feel free to invite people to join the group. I purposely set RSVPs to not allow guests.

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ.  

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)


Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

STAND UP NY is one of the BEST and CLASSIEST clubs in NYC. Tickets are usually $25 - $30 but the club has given our Meetup group a free admission. It is still a 2 drink or item minimum as in any other comedy club (around $18)

results.description:
Join Us For $2 Tuesdays At Wallington Lanes!

Bowling is always a fun activity no matter your age. Wallington Lanes is a huge bowling alley that has a bar and a concession stand to order food. They play some good upbeat music as your bowling. They also added a game area with basketball shooting, racing arcade games, and pool tables.

You only pay $2 for bowling shoes, $2 per game, and $2 on select beers.

Expect To Pay About $8 As We'll Play 2 Games Per Person Plus The Shoe Cost.

2 Games x $2= $4 Plus Tax

Bowling Shoes= $2 Plus Tax 

Any food or drinks you want to order will be at your expense. If your interested in just coming out to watch and not playing, that's ok to. The bowling alley is located on Paterson Plank Road in Wallington NJ. It's brightly colored in Red & Black paint on the exterior of the building.

We'll meet by the bar and pool table area, to the right when you walk in. Look for a meetup sign. Please arrive by 7:30pm so we can start shortly after.

results.description:
This is the time of year we look back at the past, reflect what we have achieved and what we are inspiring to work towards.

There are just less than 2 months of this year at this time, there is plenty of time to start NOW and work at your goals that you have in place.

We believe it is an ongoing process, so don’t wait until “January 1st” to start your goals. IE. Weight loss, exercising, savings.

One of the goals you can have in place is prepare and plan your course of action, to reach your goals/Why. That way you get started right out of the gate.

We developed the next 2 meetings to help you with your goals, vision, and passion.

Can you imagine your energy level once you put your thoughts, feelings, emotions, vision behind your goals?

Session 1: November 17th

We are going to focus on the 8 lanes of your life, bucket list. Assist you in creating short term goals, that you can achieve and long term goals.

8 Lanes of Life

1.  Relationships

2.  Health

3.  Business

4.  Finances

5.  Personal Development

6.  Spirituality

7.  Community

8.  Social

Tony Robbins: Got Purpose.

Session 2: December 15th

Vision Boards!! 

Have an amazing week, we extremely excited for the upcoming classes!

Thank you,


Ed and LaToya

results.description:
ORGANIZER: Shelly Sadon

WHAT: ice skating with the optional bite to eat afterwards.

WHERE: Winter Village rink at Bryant Park (the park is located in the square block between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and between 41st and 42nd Streets in Midtown Manhattan)
Olympic Pita 58 W 38th St (212)[masked]

WHEN: Tuesday, November 17, 2015 at 8 PM (until approximately 11 PM)

COST: Skating is free if you have your own skates, otherwise there is a charge for skate rentals $15 (the price goes up to $19 after Nov 20th)
Lockers are free if you have your own lock, to buy a lock there it cost $9;
There is an option to check your bag, it costs $8-$10 depending on bag size.
So in reality your cost will depend on whether you have your own skates, your own lock, and whether you bring a bag or not. (There is also a skate sharpening service for $20.)

THE PLAN
The plan is to arrive at around 8 PM (you can arrive later if you need to) to meet up in the lobby, check in with me, and rent skates; hit the ice around 8:15 and skate until around 9:30; Head over to Olympic Pita at 58 W 38th St, about 2 blocks south of the park, until closing time around 11 pm.


IMPORTANT FRIENDLY TIPS
-Leave extra baggage at home.
-If you have your own lock, bring it and save yourself the lock purchase fee.
-There is a safety rule against skating with any type of bag on, including backpacks, which is strictly enforced by the staff on the rink.
-Bring your friends!

For more information about Bryant park and Olympic pita:

http://www.nycgovparks.org/facilities/iceskating/3

http://www.bryantpark.org/things-to-do/wintervillage.html

http://olympicpita.com/index.php?route=product/category&path=59

I hope you can join us!

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions.

It's that time of year again! The autumn colors, the
chill in the air, the preoccupation about food and family.
It's all so distracting! What better way to center yourself than to spend an evening exercising your artistic spirit, enjoying the company of your fellow artists, and being inspired and entertained, Draw-mania! style!

Every edition of Draw-mania! features fantastic nude models, an outstanding DJ playing the music you want to hear and some truly unique live entertainment! And, of course, we're in New York's Coolest, funkiest Tiki bar, offering affrodable beers and awesome tiki cocktails!
 
Bring your favorite art supplies and your most creative friends and expect to have a ball while you create great art. It's a fun and lively event for all levels of artistic experience, from pros to total beginners.

Think of it as a party that's also an investment in your creative abilities! What other event have you been to lately you can say that about?

All this amazement for a mere $20 smackers at the door!

As always:
Over 21 only--I.D. will be checked
Admission price does not include beverages
No outside beverages
No photography
Bring your own art supplies

results.description:
Note: Still trying to find out what's up with tickets to this performance. At this moment none are available and show opens on Broadway in February. Will keep you all posted.

Academy Award-winning actress Lupita Nyong’o (“12 Years a Slave”) will make her New York stage debut this fall in the Public Theater’s production of the war drama “Eclipsed,” written by the Obie Award-winning playwright Danai Gurira (“In the Continuum”).

Set in 2003 near the end of the civil war in Liberia, the play is about a group of women who are captives of rebels fighting the government. In a statement the Public Theater’s artistic director, Oskar Eustis, called the work a “feminist reading” of the African conflict that is “both heart-breaking and profoundly life-affirming.”

“Eclipsed” will be directed by Liesl Tommy, who staged the play’s premiere at the Woolly Mammoth Theater in Washington in 2009. In his review of a production at Yale Repertory Theater that same year, Charles Isherwood wrote that the play “depicts the harsh realities of women’s lives in a strife-torn African country with both a clear eye and a palpable empathy.”

Previews (which appear to be sold out) begin at the Public on Sept. 29 through Oct. 11. It continues through Nov. 29, with prices going up from $70 to $80. Check their website!
Show is 2 1/2 hours long appx. - tkts are $80 from Nov. 10 - 29. (I'm inquiring about group rates)
results.name: Public Theatre presents Lupita Nyong'o in'Eclipsed' - No tickets at this time.

results.description:
Hate has no holiday.  Divorce may be one of the most contentious experiences that people have to go through in their lifetime.  Choosing a top matrimonial attorney in NJ can be a difficult process.  Without a strong referral from a trusted friend, many people find themselves forced into a huge decision based on their intuition and attorney websites.  Steven Segalas, a certified matrimonial attorney and Partner with Damiano Law Offices in Little Falls, NJ will be speaking about the importance of selecting the right attorney.  Mr. Segalas has been practicing law for the last 20 years  almost exclusively in the area of matrimonial law and domestic relations both before trial courts and appellate level.  Steven  will be able to detail the entire process itself, including the aspects of alimony, support payments, settlement agreements with asset distribution, as well as annulments. Steven will be able to show us how the whole process begins and how he brings it to a final agreed upon solution.  Steven is giving us the rare opportunity to see how this whole process works.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on Nov 18th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

Big Data Seminar - Featuring Real-World Big Data Use Cases

NOVEMBER 18, 2015 | 7:30-10:30 AM | EVENTI HOTEL, NEW YORK

Still experimenting with big data? Are you ready to get "in the trenches" with real business use cases and applications? Join us for a free educational breakfast seminar to explore the current trends in search and big data through real-world use cases in diverse business areas. Learn from industry experts - get insights into how various companies are using big data and search in different ways to discover competitive insights, drive business productivity, and increase revenue.

New to big data? Come explore how it works for you. A big data veteran? Join and share your experience with us.

Our speakers:

Doug Bleszinski, Area Vice President, Elastic
Don Durrang, Northeast Regional Director, Cloudera
Paul Nelson, Chief Architect, Search Technologies
Join our Big Data seminar and bring home these practical takeaways:

How big data technologies are improving enterprise search and business intelligence, and how you can exploit this
The real business impact of using big data for risk management and compliance in financial services
Leveraging search and big data technologies for fraud detection by searching transactional data warehouses
Increase conversion rate, Net Promoter Score (NPS), and revenue in e-commerce with big data
Using open source log analytics solutions to analyze risks, business transactions, user behavior, network performance, and market trends
Trends and best practices into how you can make search and big data a strategic part of your business

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
Power up to go from rejection to selection


** Do you dread having sales conversations?

**Does asking for the money make you feel uneasy?

**Do you easily discount yourself?

〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰〰

Connect 2 Coach Proudly presents Regina Huber, one of our expert coaches who will lead you to being Freaking Amazing! Regina trained with Amazing Gloria Feldt and will be incorporating her Leadership tools to Advance Your Career.

Regina will show you how to go from a “no” to a “yes” in your business so you can sign on the clients you want to work with, charge what your services are worth, and bring in more money.

This webinar is NOT for you if you are looking for a sales script. Regina believes you have to find your own style: Your products and services are unique, and so are you as the person who offers them. What works for me, may not work for you. What works for some of the big gurus in your industry, may not work for you. Because it doesn’t feel authentic to who you are, and your prospects will feel that.

This webinar IS FOR YOU if you are looking for new ways to prepare for sales conversations, speaking, and other challenging business situations. It’s not enough to be the expert and know that your offer is right for your prospect. When it comes to closing deals, we have to start by eliminating the blocks that are in our way, by upgrading our mindset so it supports our sales goals and our success. Then we have to get clear on how we can distinguish ourselves through our “unique assets.” And here’s something we often forget about: We have to be fully present in our body and in our energy. People feel that, even over the phone. Regina will share some tools that help you get prepared so you can take focused action and bring in more business.

RSVP to reserve your place HERE

results.name: Free Webinar - From Freaking Out to Freaking AMAZING!

results.description:
I'm so excited to be introducing our third webinar for Bibliocrunch members. You must register at the link below to attend. You can attend from your computer at home in  your pajamas. 

I’ve helped numerous authors with their SEO strategy, so I thought I’d package all the information into one webinar. I’ll be teaching you tips and techniques on how to up your rank in Google and other search engines.

Overview of the course: SEO & How to Rank Higher in Google as an Author

REGISTER FOR THE WEBINAR

Google. It’s the black box that no one really knows what goes on in there. However there are few things you can do to optimize your page so that you can rank higher as an author on Google. After all, what’s the point of writing a book or having a website if potential readers can’t find it in search? 

This webinar will focus on: 

1) Structuring your site 
2) How to optimize your meta data 
3) How to blog and link effectively for SEO 
4) Sitemaps 
5) Optimize Amazon search pages 
6) Make sure your book gets discovered

Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014
--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind 

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 1:00 PM – 2:30 PM

 Day: Wednesdays 

Where: Room #102, 

Freeport Recreation Center 

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520 

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Urban agriculture is growing rapidly in cities across America. Vacant lots, abandoned green spaces, and even rooftops are being transformed into productive farms that provide fresh produce and opportunities for healthy activity, income, and many other benefits for urban families. Can the unprecedented growth of urban agriculture continue? Can urban farms produce enough food to feed large numbers of city residents? What new policies must be adopted to improve and promote urban agriculture? Will rooftop and vertical gardening systems increase the productivity of urban farms? What benefits beyond food production does urban agriculture provide to the community? Growing the Urban Farm, presented by the Garden's Bronx Green-Up program, features four distinguished speakers who will address these critical questions and offer inspiration to experienced and aspiring urban farmers alike.

Featured Speakers:

Mchezaji Axum, Director of the Center for Urban Agriculture and Gardening Education in the College of Agriculture Urban Sustainability and Environmental Sciences at the University of the District of Columbia.
Drawing from his extensive research on urban agriculture and his experience with urban farming in Washington, D.C., Axum will provide an overview of the current state of urban agriculture in American cities.

Nevin Cohen, Associate Professor, CUNY School of Public Health.
Cohen will provide a socioeconomic and policy perspective with an emphasis on urban agriculture's important contributions to social and environmental justice. He has a forthcoming book on the topic, written with colleague Kristin Reynolds, Beyond the Kale: Urban Agriculture and Social Justice Activism in New York City.

**<a>READ MORE & REGISTER FOR EVENT</a>**

Event Costs -

Member - $10

Non-member - $20

***NOTE FROM ORGANIZER*** - Robert Hubbard

Even though I do not  personal support Animal Agriculture due to  the fact that it is easily the #1 reason why our planet is the way it is now. ie. global warming, ocean dead zones, water waste, deforestation, and more..... So if I do attend I will be ready to ask some very good questions for the speakers.
results.how_to_find_us: NYBG - Ross Lecture Hall
results.name: Growing the Urban Farm

results.description:
Hi - our No SQL – What should you know? meetup is taking place next Wednesday.  If you have registered, but have not provided me with your full name and company, you will not be able to get into the building.

Please reach out to me directly at [masked] with those details. 


Thank you.

In an era of big data where complex, diverse data sets need to be treated as a unified whole, firms are searching for database technologies that can provide uninterrupted access to diverse data sets. This also allows for scaling to massive levels with full search abilities. The penalty for not meeting these requirements can range from poor decisions to fines and criminal sanctions.

In recent years data needs faced by businesses have become ever more complex and demanding. The limits and lack of flexibility of legacy database systems have become an obstacle to the development and deployment of systems requiring these new needs.

NoSQL databases are a key technology - enabling firms to handle the new demands. Spend some time with MarkLogic on Wednesday, November 18 over drinks and food while we cover:

• History of NoSQL

• Key functionality that provide its power

• Review the different kinds of NoSQL databases

Wednesday, November 18

1 Penn Plaza, 42nd Floor

5:30PM – 7:00PM

Please RSVP directly to [masked],[masked]-6645.  For security reasons to get into the building, please include your full name, title, email and phone.

While you are on-site, enter to win a Parrot AR Drone Quadricopter, 2.0 Elite Edition, 720p – it’s super cool!!!!
results.name: No SQL – What should you know?

Join us for our monthly business networking group at Rockn' Joe in Union Station. As usual, we will start with open networking from 6 pm to 7 pm followed by a presentation.  This month, our topic is "Overcoming your Fears with your Business and your Life" presented by Frances Camilleri:

As a highly trained, Certified Life Coach and Motivational Speaker, Frances Camilleri brings extensive knowledge and experience in helping her clients discover, design and manifest a life that’s in harmony with their Soul’s purpose and create rich, fulfilling, happy lives.

Frances has her Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Associate’s Degree in Physical Therapy and is an ACE certified Personal Trainer.  She has dedicated over 20 years of her life to personal growth and helping others realize their full potential and create lives they love living.

In enabling her clients to live their dreams, she is fulfilling her own dream because nothing makes her happier than seeing her clients succeed in every area – health, relationships, career and time/money freedom.

“When you’re in harmony and alignment with your True self, when you are living on purpose”, Frances says, “life is easier and so much more fun!”

As a sought after Life Coach, professional speaker, and results expert, Frances offers individual consultations and inspiring, interactive workshops to groups and organizations. Her transformational in-depth coaching programs help clients achieve new heights of success, meaning and aliveness. The techniques Frances applies guide her clients to their unique vision of success.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Come and join us in the exciting world of rock climbing! It will challenge your physical and mental endurance while having fun and making new friends!! Test yourself on: Over 30,000 square feet of indoor climbing terrain. One of the largest rock gym in the country. Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing 16ft Top-Out Bouldering Rappel Tower. Expertly set routes for all ability levels, from kids to pros. 


We will provide training for first-timers on first day. Also, the gym runs 'Climbing 101' classes which instruct on how to climb, tie the basic knots, belay fellow climbers, etc. We look forward to meet new friends, share our knowledge, and equip members with rock climbing safety practices and habits.

Get your climb on!

***AFTER  our HARD night of climbing, we will grab beer and BBQ at John Brown's which is a block away from the Cliffs. 

Leader: Julie 


*Cliffs Liability Waiver: Must Fill Out when you get in the Gym 
Event Type: Wall indoor top rope and lead

Day Pass: $24 including shoes and harness rental

Demonstration Time:
Figure "8" Demo - 645p (1st group)
Figure "8" Demo - 715p (2nd group)


Meetup Benefits for Cliffs Membership:
Free Initiation Fee
Current Monthly Membership Charge
3 extra day free passes
Please let me know if you have questions.

Location:

THE CLIFFS AT LONG ISLAND CITY
[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101
[masked]-ROCK (7625)

Getting Here:

Subway:
E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days

Metro North & LIRR:

From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square.

Beginners - Please take time to watch these videos (Copy and Paste)

How to Tie A Figure 8 Knot-


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tFffbkXSgNI

Basic Rock Climbing Commands -


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CrxgWU2BFBM

How to Belay -


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w5ZT9M9m_2Y

The Cliffs at Long Island City is the largest rock climbing gym on the east coast! The walls range from beginner to expert difficulty, so there is something to climb for everyone. If you have ever wanted to try rock climbing for the first time, or if you're a pro, this is the place to do it!
results.name: The Cliffs Rock Climbing Then Beer+BBQ-No Experience Necessary

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

results.description:
Do you have ideas floating around in your mind and you want to do something about them?  In Vivo Clarity can help you develop an action plan against a timeline AND priorities your actions accordingly.


This workshop will give you an overview of the work that is done with coaching clients. You will come away from this workshop:


· Identifying a central goal


· Developing your action plan that will get you to your goal


· Quantitatively deciding what is a priority


· Moving forward


Please come prepared to develop an action plan -- prepare to THINK and WORK.

Bring laptop if you have one, if not, please bring a pad and pen.


Please note: WiFi not available at the center.


The goal of the workshops are to be able to provide you with the coaching guidance you need in order to finally get a grip on what you need to be doing and DO IT.  Once the session is concluded, you will have a plan that you can act on immediately.

We identify your central goal and go from there.  You will be surprised how thought provoking these workshops can be.  As always mentioned be prepared to THINK and WORK.  

These meetings are open to young professionals, entrepreneurs, solopreneurs, business owners, and even individuals that want an action plan tied to a timeline to achieve their goals.


Address: New York Open Center : 22 East 30th Street, NYC 10016

Conference Rm 3A


This event is not affiliated with the Open Center


Fee: $45 (no walk-ins; limited to 15 participants)

If meeting is full, please email the owner of this meeting to be put on a wait list.

invivoclarity.com
results.how_to_find_us: info@invivoclarity.com
results.name: Drill Down to One Workshop :  Real-Time Goal Setting

group.name: In Vivo Clarity Executive & Life Coaching

results.description:
What to look forward to:

Four people at each table with Nancy and Audrey, your co-hosts, floating between tables, jotting down "overheard nuggets."  Come for the free-flowing conversation - without facilitators or agenda. You can count on a nice mix of ages, experiences, backgrounds, and so on.

Location:

Death Café meets at Hunan Manor, 339 Lexington between 39th-40th Street. In exchange for your PayPal payment of $11, we enjoy their private second floor space, endless pots of tea and small plates of savory foods, vegetable-noodle soup and fresh fruit. If you order beer, wine or sake or other dishes at Hunan Manor, that separate check is your responsibility.

Note: Hunan Manor's second floor is not handicapped-accessible.

No-Shows and Wanna-Be-There(s):

If you are not coming, even if it's a last minute decision, please have the courtesy of RSVP-ing "NO" on our Meetup.com page so your seat can be filled by someone who really wants to be here.

If you're looking for a Death Café closer to home (or a more structured version where the host leads the conversation), check out our Meetup page entitled "All NYC Death Cafés by Location" to join Death Cafés located in other parts of the city.

Stuff people say at our Death Café:

Co-host Nancy Gershman travels from table to table to capture what people say, and puts it up on our Overheard Nuggets page. But if you hear some really memorable things at Death Café, please race home to write it down on our Facebook page. Or email your hosts through Meetup.com so we can add them to our collection.

FACEBOOK: 

Visit our Death Café Facebook page to get some of the brain-sharpening items and announcements we don’t broadcast on Meetup:

 News you can use (and haven't heard before)   Discount tickets to lecture series, art talks and more  Live Q&As with film directors   The Tragicomedia Interviews (where Death Café NYC’s Nancy Gershman interviews comedians about the healthy ways they process loss and regrets)    Early peeks at upcoming excursions (such as to 2014’s Metropolitan Museum of Art/ Costume Institute show, “Death Becomes Her”)

Make sure to visit and LIKE Death Café NYC on Facebook so that these goodies float in your Timeline and you can share them with others.

See you soon!

your hosts, Audrey and Nancy
results.how_to_find_us: Subway stops: 42 St. at Lexington
results.name: DEATH CAFE,  Wed. Nov. 18, 2015

results.description:
This meetup group has been invited to be "initial insiders" for the new smartphone app "First Call." This app gets you your first drink free at any of more than 50 pubs and bars in New York.

So we'll get to learn more about the app, give feedback to the founders and yes, get our first drink free at the Beekman Pub, one of downtown New York's classic old bars,  a Financial District fixture since 1936.

The happy hour, which will be a joint event with my New York Irish Pub Challenge group, will also feature complimentary hot and cold hors d'oeuvres, $3 Bud Light drafts, $5 Highlander Ale drafts, $5 house wine and $5 house mixed drinks, and $6 shots of Jameson's Black Barrel whiskey.

Click HERE to check out the First Call app. Use code "OLDBARS" to get the first week free. The app is so far only available for iOS devices, but an Android version is in the works. You will need to download the app to get your free drink at the happy hour. Don't have an iPhone? No problem, we'll give you directions on how to claim your free drink at the happy hour.

Should be a fun night as we get to take a sneak peek at an exciting new app designed for people who want to get out and enjoy the pubs and bars of New York.
results.name: First Call Launch Happy Hour at the Beekman Pub

results.description:
We are happy to invite you to New York's leading Microsoft Azure User Group Meetup - designed to bring together New York's Microsoft Azure development and infrastructure community to talk about challenges, roadmap, what we'd like to see in future releases, and overall user experience.

Abstract:

Specific environments and business needs often dictate the need for custom OS images in azure with specific software configurations. While this is a fairly straightforward process on windows, Linux systems require a bit of extra attention and can be successfully migrated from a local VM for development into Azure with only a handful of steps. 

Speaker:

Jason is a Cloud Solutions Engineer at Nimbo with 10 years experience designing, managing, and building solutions in the UNIX and Linux ecosystems with a heavy focus on stability, security, and cost management.  


Feedback

We are dedicated to remain New York's best Microsoft Azure Meetup Group - a high reaching goal that can only be achieved with our group members' input. If you have any suggestions on which topics you'd like to see covered, speakers you want to hear present or anything else you can think of, don't hesitate to <a>contact us</a>.

Please use our hashtag on Twitter to tweet about this user group: #NYCAZURE

Hope to see you there!

We will now be meeting every 3rd Wednesday of each month at 6pm.

If you have suggestions or are interested in presenting please e-mail us: [masked].
results.name: Creating Azure Machines from Custom Linux VMs

Our last meetup of 2015 will be something you won't want to miss - we will have the Elie Tahari Boutique in Soho all to ourselves!  Mingle with other women in B2B marketing as you browse the racks for holiday party dresses, winter clothing, accessories and more.

Elie Tahari has generously offered all attendees 20% off of full price merchandise. They will also feature an annual sale selection marked down to 40% off. Wine and appetizers will be also served.

Cheers to a fabulous holiday season - hope to see you there!
results.name: M2M Holiday Meetup: Clothes, Wine & Networking

results.description:
Hello,

Join us on Wednesday November 18th @ 6 PM.

We have a new leadership team and its sure to be a great 2016.  Come out and meet them.  Hear about some of their plans and share your ideas on things we can do in 2016.

 The new members of the leadership team area:

• Jonathan F. Kestenbaum (Executive Director at Talent Tech Labs)

• Carissa Palmieri-McGeown (Global Head of Talent Acquisition Technology at Marsh & McLennan Companies)

• Tania Zivkovic (Director, Talent Success at LivePerson)

Agenda:

6-6:30, Social Time
6:30-7:30pm, Programming, Speaker(s)

• Select for one of three group discussions on concurrent topics (like Boolean search, branding, effective emails/inmails, and metrics/models). Each will be 30 minutes and moderated by a recruiting leader.

• Demo of Untapt, a new data-driven platform that uses complete candidate and hiring-side data sets to create precise connections between technology talent and open roles in FinTech.


• 7:30-8:15pm, Social Time

Cheers,

Ernie
results.name: Nov Meetup - Meet New Leadership Team and more

results.description:
***You must RSVP via Eventbrite. RSVPs on Meetup.com will not grant you access to our event. Please purchase your ticket at Eventbrite.*** 

Conversations is a series of events focused on open discussions on the changing new media landscape. Our events will feature panels with insights from the most respected news organizations, the newest disruptive publishers, and tech and media thought leaders. Through conversations, let’s work to transform media together. 

As data is becoming increasingly available, how are media companies digesting and presenting data to best communicate and illustrate their stories and products? How do journalists know when data is reliable? How is data impacting the way news is presented and reported? How is data driving business decisions within an organization? For our November event, "How Data is Changing Media Companies," our panelists will discuss and debate their thoughts on what lies ahead for them and for the industry as a whole.

PANELISTS

* Brian Abelson (Co-Creator, NewsLynx)

* John Keefe (Senior Editor, WNYC Data News Team)

* Sisi Wei (Investigative Journalist and Developer, ProPublica)

* Chris Wiggins (Associate Professor, Columbia; Chief Data Scientist, New York Times)

* MODERATOR: Stephanie Salmon (VP, Data & Information Strategy, U.S. News & World Report, L.P.) 

SCHEDULE 

6:00-6:30: Registration / Networking Reception 
6:30-7:30: Panel discussion and Q&A 
7:30-8:30: Networking Reception 

RSVP for the event here: http://www.nydn.us/convos

For 25% off of the admission price, members of this Meetup group may use the discount code: MEETUPFRIEND 

Presented by the Daily News Innovation Lab (http://www.nydn.us/lab).

***You must RSVP via Eventbrite. RSVPs on Meetup.com will not grant you access to our event. Please purchase your ticket atEventbrite.***
results.name: Conversations: How Data is Changing Media Companies

results.description:
Gobble Gobble! We're deep into fall and the air is getting cold, so now's your chance to take advantage of an opportunity to join us at an open house in our NYC office next to Central Park. It doesn't matter if you're totally new to AMC, just joined, or are a veteran of the club; everyone is welcome to attend! We will be giving a quick presentation about the AMC and the activities the New York-North Jersey Chapter offer. Bring your questions if you have them and we'll give you all of the information needed to get outdoors. You'll get a chance to meet and socialize with some experienced members of the club and ask them about what makes them passionate about the AMC and what got them involved. Light refreshments will be provided.

Space is limited, so please email Justin Bailey [masked] to register.
results.name: Open House NYC

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

results.description: Housing costs in New York City rise relentlessly, and commutes lengthen. Politicians call for more affordable housing. Yet the financial incentives available to developers encourage construction of luxury apartments. The infamous 421a tax abatements are peddled as the only way affordable housing can be provided, although examples abound to scuttle that deceit. The City’s infrastructure crumbles from lack of investment. Are investor incentives destroying our city? Marty Rowland charts the mismatch between the demand for and supply of affordable housing, and offers an alternative paradigm that is fair and just. Marty Rowland studied economics under Daniel W. Bromley, emeritus professor of applied economics at the University of Wisconsin at Madison, and used the theories of Bromley and Elinor Ostrom on common pool resource management systems. A Georgist since his arrival in NYC in 2009, Marty is active in presenting his ideas – most recently at the John Jay College’s Left Forum. His day job is with the NYC Department of Parks & Recreation as Senior Environmental Engineer. Marty is a licensed professional engineer, Certified Passive House Designer, and designer of permaculture systems.
results.name: Housing Policy and Investor Incentives – the Curious Case of the 421A in NYC

results.description:
Urban agriculture is growing rapidly in cities across America. Vacant lots, abandoned green spaces, and even urban rooftops are being transformed into productive farms that provide fresh produce and opportunities for healthy activity, income, and many other benefits for urban families. Can the unprecedented growth of urban agriculture continue? Can urban farms produce enough food to feed large numbers of city residents? What new policies must be adopted to improve and promote urban agriculture? Will rooftop and vertical gardening systems increase the productivity of urban farms? What techniques can we employ to be better growers? What benefits beyond food production does urban agriculture provide to the community? Growing the Urban Farm will feature four distinguished speakers who will address these critical questions and offer inspiration to experienced and aspiring urban farmers alike.

Mchezaji “Che” Axum, Director of the Center for Urban Agriculture and Gardening Education at the University of the District of Columbia.

Annie Novak, Manager of the Edible Academy, The New York Botanical Garden and founder of Eagle Street Rooftop Farms

Nevin Cohen, Associate Professor, CUNY School of Public Health

Karen Washington, Community activist, gardener, and farmer

This symposium is presented by Bronx Green-Up, the Garden’s steadfast community gardening program, which has been instrumental in the Bronx for the last 27 years. For more information visit: http://www.nybg.org/green_up/urban-agriculture-symposium.php

Registered GreenThumb and Bronx Green-Up gardeners are eligible for the NYBG Member rate of $10. To obtain the discount rate, please contact 718.817.8026.

The Symposium will be located at the New York Botanical Garden, Ross Hall.
results.name: Symposium: Growing the Urban Farm

results.description:
IMPORTANT: RSVP ON EVENTBRITE AS WELL https://www.eventbrite.com/e/physics-philosophy-and-the-new-atheism-tickets-19068790265

Another great event at Union Theological Seminary!

After the event concludes, Sunday Assembly people are invited to get together at Toast 125 (3157 Broadway, New York, NY 10027) to eat and chat about the evening.


Robert Wright, Visiting Professor of Science and Religion at Union Theological Seminary, interrogates prominent physicist and ‘new atheist’ Lawrence Krauss on the origins of the universe, quantum weirdness, and the limits of scientific knowledge.

LAWRENCE KRAUSS is director of the Origins Project and Professor of Physics at Arizona State University. He has won numerous international awards and is the only physicist to have received the top awards from all three U.S. Physics Societies.  He is the author of over 300 scientific publications and is also the author of 9 books including bestsellers The Physics of Star Trek and A Universe from Nothing: Why There is Something Rather than Nothing. Krauss has recently delved into the film world as executive producer and subject of The Unbelievers, a documentary film that discusses science and reason.  He has dedicated his time, throughout his career, to issues of science and society and has helped spearhead national efforts to educate the public about science, ensure sound public policy, and defend science against attacks at a variety of levels. In 2015 Krauss was named Humanist of the Year.

ROBERT WRIGHT is the author, most recently, of The Evolution of God, which was a New York Timesbestseller and a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize. His other books include The Moral Animal, which The New York Times Book Reviewnamed one of the ten best books of 1994, and Nonzero, which Bill Clinton called “astonishing” and instructed White House staff members to read. In 2009 Wright was named by Foreign Policy magazine as one of the top 100 global thinkers. Wright has written for The Atlantic, The New Yorker, The New York Times Magazine, Foreign Policy, and the op-ed pages of The New York Times, The Washington Post, and The Financial Times. His books have been translated into more than a dozen languages, and his awards include the National Magazine Award for Essay and Criticism. Wright is Visiting Professor of Science and Religion at Union Theological Seminary in New York, and is editor-in-chief of the websites Bloggingheads.tv and MeaningofLife.tv. 

This event is part of “Contentions,” an interview and debate series hosted by Robert Wright, Visiting Professor of Science and Religion at Union Theological Seminary. Through conversations with prominent intellectuals, “Contentions” examines the relationship between science and spiritual questions.
results.name: Physics, Philosophy, and the 'New Atheism'

results.description:
• Great intro to Arduino

• Shows some of the capabilities of the Arduino

• Self paced, ask questions as you play !

• Continue where you left off last Class 



This is a fully hands on class. Just connect your Arduino and we will walk through example code together. This class will focus on getting you up and running with Arduino quickly, so that you can begin to explore the world of Arduino on your own.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YCqFHuyT7qc

This class will be run using the Basic Kit by Sain Smart which can be purchased for $25.00, so you can continue to work on  projects at home.  See below for details. 

We can also provide you with a Sparkfun’s Inventor Kit which will be available for use during the session.

Examples & PDF can be found here: Zip file with PDF instructions & Example code with Data sheets

We will be walking through the following example codes


Circuit Examples:

Circuit 1: Blinking an LED

Circuit 2: Reading a Potentiometer

Circuit 3: Driving and RGB LED

Circuit 4: Driving Multiple LEDs

Circuit 5: Push Buttons

Circuit 6: Reading a Photo Resistor

Circuit 7: Reading a Temperature Sensor

Circuit 8: Driving a Servo Motor

Circuit 9: Using a Flex Sensor

Circuit 10: Reading a Soft Potentiometer

Circuit 11: Using a Buzzer

Circuit 12: Driving a Motor

Circuit 13: Using Relays

Circuit 14: Using a Shift Register

Circuit 15: Using an LCD

Circuit 16: Simon Says


Before the Workshop

Please bring your laptop. Arduino runs on Windows, Mac OSX, and Linux. Download the (free) Arduino software prior to the workshop from http://arduino.cc/en/Main/Software, and install as much as you can. Instructions at http://arduino.cc/en/Guide/HomePage

*A limited number of laptops will be provided if you choose not to bring your own.

*An Arduino kit will be provided for use during the workshop or you may bring your own. Purchase your own kit to take home, see details below.

If you have questions prior to or after the workshop please contact the instructor Brian Cook @  [masked]


We will also be selling small basic kits if you would like to purchase your own. Here are the kits we will have available. Please bring cash or check for the materials if you would like to purchase your own kit. Please RSVP with the specific board you would like so we can make sure enough kits are purchased. We have attached the link to the kits for more information and to take a look at what's included or specific specs for each kit.

Feel free to RSVP or comment with questions, comments or concerns.

Thank you

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be located inside the restaurant section by the windows

results.description:
We present a talk by Filipe Ximenez about his work on Tapioca an API wrapper framework.

Also BuzzFeed System Engineer Dan Meruelo shows how to stress test your web servers so you can stay calm on launch.

Additional lightning talks are welcome on recent launches, useful packages,  life hacks and other topics of interest. 

Title: 

Better API wrappers with Tapioca

Using a web API wrapper is often painful. Wrappers documentation are often poor requiring us to reach to the official API docs, there's absolutely no consensus on how to expose API endpoints neither how far should a wrapper go to help us making HTTP requests. And if using wrappers is hard, writing them requires too much effort and time. Although most of them support similar features, none of them share any code, so every wrapper developer has to design endpoint requests, auth, pagination, error handling and tons of other stuff. Tapioca (https://github.com/vintasoftware/tapioca-wrapper) is a API wrapper framework that solves all this problems and allows learning how to use a new service wrapper in no time and writing new ones in a few minutes. 

Speaker:

Filipe is a Python/Django developer from Brazil and works at Vinta Software (www.vinta.com.br). Open source, APIs, REST and bikes are some of the subjects he is mainly interested on. Making new friends and drinking beer are main goals of his stay in New York, please help.

============================

Title: 

How to Stress test your web servers.

Speaker: Dan is System Engineer at BuzzFeed.
results.name: Django on the Djob:  Tapioca

results.description:
This free workshop teaches how to use the compass in interaction with a map. If you are hiking on marked trails or bushwhacking to areas not far from trails, a good topographic map may be the only tool you need to plan and maintain your route. If you are planning to be in the wilderness for an extended period of time, you will most likely be using a compass to help you find your way.

COMPASS AND PENCIL REQUIRED. PLEASE DO NOT USE A SMART PHONE APPLICATION

Instructor: Hank Osborn - East Hudson Program Coordinator for the NY-NJ Trail Conference.

Seats are limited

Contact Jamie Lipman Abish @ email - [masked]

You must register with Tents and Trails by emailing Jamie so please do so right after you RSVP to claim your spot as they are limited.

results.description:
Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must pre pay online)

WHERE: Irish Exit (978 2nd Ave, New York, NY - at 52nd St.)
WHEN: Wednesday, November 18th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
