results.description:
Let's meetup and do some post-work ice skating.

If the group is up for it, after skating we can grab a diner/drinks together, somewhere close by.

Aside from being fun, ice skating is a good workout and a nice practice for anyone who enjoys winter sports, especially skiers - the balance/movements you go through on skis and ice skates are very similar.
If you are a beginner skier or you plan to learn skiing this season, you'll have one more reason to join us for some ice skating...I'll give you some basic tips and help you get going on the ice.

Winter Village at Bryant Park is Manhattan's first and only free admission ice skating rink. Back for its tenth season, ice skating rink at Bryant Park is one of NYC's most treasured winter destinations.

Schedule:

The plan is to meet at 6:30 PM inside the rink facility by the lockers.
(Entrance to the facility is from the 40th street, middle of the block)
This is where we will change and put ice skates on before proceeding to the ice.

Bring a lock - lockers are free, but if you do not have one you'll have to either buy it at the counter ($9) or check in your bag (and pay a $8 or $10 fee). Note - lockers are quite small so if you have a lot of stuff or wear size 13 shoes like me, you may need to use two lockers - so bring two locks.


Cost:
Access to the ice skating rink is free, and so is the use of lockers (you need to bring your lock!).
However, the ice-skates rental is not free.
If you have a pair of ice skates, then you won't pay a dime; but if you do not have your own ice-skates, and can't borrow them from a friend/relative, you'll have to rent them at the facility for $15 for a skating period (you can stay as long as you want 8AM-10PM).
If you plan on ice skating more than 2 times this season, I suggest you to purchase a pair of ice skates; there are some incredibly cheap skates out there - girls can pick up a pair for as low as $30...
Just make sure they fit you OK (thigh but not blistering tight), get the cheapest pair, and disregard all selling points salesman will try to put out there...

Transportation:
Getting to the Bryant park is easy.
Take subway line B,D,F or M to the 42nd Street - Bryan park stop...
or 7 line to the 5th Ave stop...
or N, R, Q, 1, 2 or 3 line to the Times Square - 42nd Street stop and walk one Ave block east.
The entrance to the ice skating rink is from the south side of the park - 40th Street, between 5th and 6th Avenues.

What to wear:
What usually works best for me is a base layer top (thin, body tight, moisture wick shirt) with a warm sweater on the top, a scarf, a warm hat, and a pair of gloves; everything else stays in the locker - it could be a bit cold at first, but as soon as you start skating you'll start rolling your sleeves up; Again, this is what works for me - you may want to adjust the amount/type of clothing to best fit your needs.
Cell phones are not permitted on the ice - if you need to make a call/send text, you have to step off the ice.

Checking in:
When you enter the facility you will be directed to the counter where they will ask you if you have your own skates or if you need to rent a pair, ask you to sign a waiver and give you a bracelet.
After you get the bracelet, you can proceed to the lockers area.
There are some snacks/drinks sold at the facility but the prices are as they usually are in places like this...I recommend bringing a bottle of water/drink and keeping it in your locker...

DISCLAIMER

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.Full text of our liability waiver can be found on the following page:

http://www.meetup.com/Adventure-Outlet/pages/Risks_and_Waiver_of_Liability/
results.name: Ice Skating @ Bryant Park *All Levels Welcome*

Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must pre pay online)

WHERE: Irish Exit (978 2nd Ave, New York, NY - at 52nd St.)
WHEN: Wednesday, November 18th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

results.description:
Since many coworkers are usually Freelance/Independent Pro's, we thought you may be interested in attending this meetup!

**********************************************************************************

As independent workers, bill collecting often becomes a dreaded but necessary part of work. Clients can be slow to pay and sometimes, never pay. If you’re new to freelancing, you’ll soon experience the "deadbeat client".

During this FSG session, we'll answer the following:

• What do you do to get your client to pay?

• How do you deal with the situation when you're depending on that check to pay your rent?

• How can you be proactive to prevent this from happening?

Let's exchange our challenges & solutions to collectively make our freelance lives a little bit easier.

GUEST SPEAKER

As an added bonus, we've invited Attorney Jesse Strauss to join & share his legal expertise. Jesse is the Founder and CEO of Indepayment, the first debt collection service designed to meet the needs of freelancers & independent workers.
results.name: Freelancer Support Group (FSG): How To Deal With A Client Who Won't Pay

results.description:
Actors, Writers, Directors, DP's and Creatives are developing their own shows to take control and call the shots. Who is this for?

Any creator who wants to learn how to create their own web series, film or documentary. Any genre and skill level. This is an information session on how this process can help you get your film made. Also great for those who want to learn filmmaking. Every month members get together for a pitch meeting. Pitches for films or web series are made, crews are formed and the filmmaking process starts.

It is a simple process. Any member can pitch a film or web series idea that they need help on. In three minutes they express the idea, describe the crew positions they need and get people interested in their project.

Once all the pitches are heard you will have time to mingle with others and talk to the owner about working about their project.

After the information session we will have a pitch meeting for members.
results.name: LEARN HOW to PRODUCE YOUR OWN YOUR FILM OR WEB SERIES

results.description:
Its been a while since our last networking event!  We miss you!  


Lets get excited about the potential positive outcome of the Vote that will legalizing Equity Crowdfunding!  Talk to experts,  catch up with our CrowdFunding Community and enjoy happy hour priced drinks (from 6:30pm-9pm) at newly renovated Proper West Bar.   

Crowdfunding experts will be given a special name-tag to identify them. 

Experts at this event:

Alex Feldman, CEO of Crowdsunite: 

https://fbcdn-profile-a.akamaihd.net/hprofile-ak-xap1/v/t1.0-1/p320x320/10636330_10100209899596496_6821887727966802506_n.jpg?oh=7100def14f9fc18d420cca5575818f93&oe=56B711B3&__gda__=1451668326_4a6f36621dcaf6a1135ee34367c3448d

Alex helps fund great ideas online. He is CEO of CrowdsUnite which is the largest review site for funding platforms. Alex was mentioned in publications like the Entrepreneur Magazine and Huffington post. He works with government agencies teaching classes on crowdfunding to small businesses.

Jay Thakrar, Deal Sourcing at SeedInvest

Jay heads up deal sourcing at SeedInvest, a leading investment platform which connects 13,000+ institutional and accredited investors with $495MM+ in collective investor interest to highly-vetted startup investment opportunities. Prior to SeedInvest, Jay was an Investment Associate at Cambridge Associates (CA), where he specialized in private equity and venture capital.  He also founded a music and event management company, JT Entertainers, which specialized in private and corporate events globally. He studied at Babson College and the London School of Economics.  In his spare time, Jay enjoys training karate, mixing music, traveling the world, and exploring new cuisines.

Ben Center, Venture Associate at  OneVest Company



Ben leads the Investor Relations team for Onevest, a startup investing platform that connects early-stage companies with accredited investors. He also heads up business development efforts for CoFoundersLab (acquired by Onevest), a global matchmaking platform for entrepreneurs to find their co-founders and build their core teams.
results.name: Crowdfunding Networking

Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

results.description:
This is a casual and fun event for you to meet lots of other friendly singles while playing some cool games. 

Includes:

• Private Party section for our group 

• Ice Breaker Game to get you mingling 

• Billiards/Pool 

• Foosball 

• Ping Pong 

• Board Games

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fungames/

*Tickets range from $20-$35 depending on how early you purchase your ticket.

This event is not age/ethnic specific. It is also not meant to be completely gender balanced. All are welcome. 21+ 

Why RSVP says +30? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. We expect up to 40 members to attend.

Get tickets here (no door sales) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fungames/

Join Be Social Change on Wednesday, November 18th at 6:30 PM for our Nonprofit Executives + Directors Mixer, a networking event focused on connecting nonprofit executives and directors to share ideas and foster collaboration. We will have drinks, snacks, music, activities, and most importantly: a room filled with a diverse network of New York's nonprofit leaders -- connecting and learning from each other.

====================================== 

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: http://bit.ly/BSCnemNov18**

=======================================

Ticket includes drinks, snacks and an evening of facilitated networking and festivities!


** This event is for Founders, Executive Directors, CEOs, CFOs, COOs, VPs, Presidents, Directors, and Board Members. Please enter your position and organization at checkout to register.**


SCHEDULE

6:30 - 7:15pm - Check in & Networking

7:15 - 8:00pm - Facilitated Activities

8:00 - 9:00pm - Networking & Closing


SPACE PARTNERS


https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/XyC7Ut1mB36macVenekkVIQWHfSJZNYV7DvEpfIs2Qg7s4pTugwPR_rhNGGxYvoAF2yH1VnexFoRNB84H7nr0Y1hlH98RMxOL3uHehwfuYNttBZrtWC7ibisXy2FG_Hx9Xw6L_O8

Learn more at workbetter.us


Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.

results.description:
It's been a while, but we are happy to announce that we are running another exciting Disruptive Digital Marketing Meetup!

As always, this event is open to digital analytics and marketing professionals alike. So join us on Wednesday November 18th for for a fun evening of networking and a couple of drinks. Come share your biggest challenges and learn about how your peers are reacting to disruptive trends.

This time around we are lucky enough to have Adam Greco join us from Web Analytics Demystified. You’ll have the chance to “Ask Adam Anything about Being Successful in Web Analytics” in an interactive session.

The Sweetspot team will also be there to answer any questions on performance reporting and best practices in dashboard design.

See you there!
results.name: Disruptive Digital Marketing Trends & Analytics Success: Wed. November 18th

Are you tired of just working your day to day grind and jusgetting by? Why not find out how you can get out of the rat race?

The game of Cashflow simulates real-life financial management and features realistic Real Estate investing scenarios designed to show you how these types of transactions work in real life and both helps you learn how to effectively utilize them in their investing strategies. It also helps to find out your investing style, whether you are aggressive in your strategies or conservative so we can see in which of these you are most comfortable. All without the pressures of using your own money.

We will be meeting at our office in Midtown Manhattan

results.description:
Hi Nodesters! We've got three great talks this month!

Eugene Istrati - Build Web Apps using Microservices on Node.js and Serverless AWS

This session describes the underlying architecture behind www.deep.mg, the microservices marketplace built by Mitoc Group and powered by abstracted services from AWS like Amazon S3, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB. Eugene Istrati, the CTO of Mitoc Group, will dive deep into their approach to microservices architecture on serverless AWS and demonstrate how anyone can build web apps that achieve high scalability, high availability, and high performance without huge efforts or expensive resources allocation.

Lightning Talk - Dan McGhan - Relational to JSON with Node

JSON is the preferred data interchange format for most application developers today. But for many applications the relational model will continue to be the best format to persist data. But can’t we have the best of both worlds? Of course! In this session we'll look at how Node.js can be used to convert relational data to JSON.

Lightning Talk - Kamilla Khabibrakhmanova - NW.js: getting Node to Native

This talk will go over the basics of NW.js, formerly known as Node-Webkit, the Javascript library that allows you to write Native apps for your desktop environment. I'll go over reasons for choosing to make a native app versus a web app and go over how to get started creating a basic app using Nw.js.

***Note on security***: As always, please ensure your full name is listed on your Meetup profile, if you RSVP yes to join. Building security will need it to grant you access to the event.

Thanks to Shutterstock for hosting! It's going to be a great event! 

See you there!

- Matt
results.name: Three Great Talks! Microservices! NW.js! & Mapping Relational to JSON!

results.description:
NYC Technical Trader Talks invites you to join us at Precision Trading Labs for an insightful talk from options guru Frank Kneipher as he tells us about two high-percentage ways to generate income using equity options:

* covered calls
* simple credit spreads

**Covered Calls**

Many people own stocks and ETFs. Some gravitate towards those that pay a dividend in order to generate returns beyond capital appreciation. Some of us get a further kicker by selling covered calls on every long stock/ETF position we hold, similar to the income received when one owns real estate and rents it out. The premium collected from covered calls can often generate an extra  1-1.5% per month when done properly, equivalent to an annual yield of 12-18%. That's powerful. Plus when markets are jumpy and volatile, the return is often greater.

Other advantages of covered calls are:

* they can be used in either a cash account or any type of retirement account
* they lower the effective cost basis of the stock or ETF
* if you have several core holdings, each position can represents a distinct, valuable income stream, again, like owning several rental apartments
* covered calls are easy to learn and trade, and also easy to manage if market conditions change, with the proper instruction
* with the advent of weekly options, those with a good understanding of constructing covered call positions have seen their returns increase dramatically the last few years

**Credit Spreads**

Before talking about credit spreads, Frank will touch upon why the general concept of constructing a spread, i.e., a simple combination of two options, enables one to trade with an edge when properly executed.

Credit spreads, the selling of one option to generate income and buying a cheaper option in order to limit and control the risk of the trade is a great strategy that knowledgeable traders use to create a reliable income stream. They are especially appealing to those seeking to manage risk, since they can be constructed with great flexibility in balancing risk vs reward and the probability of success. They are fully customizable for the individual trader.

Frank will talk about selling bull-put spreads and bear-call spreads. Again, when properly done you're trading with an edge. This is because the credit spread will be successful if one of three things occur:

* the underlying stock or ETF moves in a predicted direction, up or down depending on the specific trade
* it stays range-bound, i.e., moves relatively sideways
* it moves a small distance opposite from the predicted direction

In baseball terms, credit spreads are analogous to hitting singles; they are limited-risk/limited-return trades, and as such, are appealing to the risk-averse. In addition, the limited-risk/limited-return characteristics of credit spreads enable one to put on these positions without needing substantial account buying power.

Yet, even with the precise risk control and limited amount of capital required, credit spreads usually achieve a far greater yield than more risky options trade structures.

Hear all about the benefits of covered calls and credit spreads from PTL's very own Frank Kneipher, a 25-year options veteran.

Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

results.description:
As a founder/cofounder, your main goal should be building an amazing user experience and acquiring customers, not spending your time on an incubator application. 

Applying to an accelerator is a daunting and time consuming task.  Are you mature enough, should you be applying, what metrics should you include, what should be required, etc?   These are the questions we will help answer with help of experienced entrepreneurs who have been accepted and gone through an accelerator.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Presenter: 

Andrew is recovering consultant turned serial entrepreneur, startup mentor and angel investor. He is the Managing Director for Dreamit’s New York program. Andrew is also a contributing writer to AlleyWatch.com, a leading destination for startup news in New York City. Andrew has founded two companies and has a keen appreciation for how hard it is to build a successful startup, even under the best of circumstances. He speaks Hebrew fluently as well as some Spanish, French, Japanese and JavaScript.

LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/in/andrewbackerman

Twitter @AndrewAckerman

Blog: http://www.AsAngelsSeeIt.com

Dreamit Ventures:

Deamit invests in early stage entrepreneurs at all levels to create breakthrough technology companies.  Their mission is to help entrepreneurs make meaningful connections with investors, customers, and strategic partners. 

Their team of advisers, investors, strategic partners and customers looking for innovative solutions is truly first class.  They run industry-specific programs focused on healthcare & education technology.  They also work with consumer  & enterprise technology entrepreneurs through their Overdrive program. 

Key Facts:

• 2 cycles per year across multiple locations (NY, Philly, Baltimore, Houston...)

• 220+ companies funded

• $250M+ raised 

• $1B+ combined value

------------------------------------------------------------------

Agenda:

• 6:30 - 7:00: Incubator Alumni Presentation


• 7:00 - 8:00: Workshop focused on drafting your application, refining your pitch, and identifying your strengths and weaknesses.  Groups of four will be randomly formed and the format will be very time focused and results driven. 


• 8:00 - 8:30: Networking


Requirements: 

• Clearly defined elevator pitch

The IP Network Series is a monthly meeting for intellectual property professionals and those who wish to learn more about IP protection and monetization, including entrepreneurs, scientists, engineers, and investors.  Each meeting will include a fireside chat and fun activity aimed at lawyers and non-lawyers alike.  Participation is free of charge.

We hope you will join us for the last event in our 2015 series, "The Importance of Design Patents," on Wednesday, November 18.  The discussion will include a focus on design patents which are an important avenue of intellectual property protection in a wide range of industries.  Design patents protect shape, surface ornamentation, or a combination of both in a wide variety of industries, from fashion articles, to consumer products, as well as software graphic user interfaces.  We will also discuss procurement and assertion of design patents.  A wine and cheese tasting will follow.

Date: Wednesday, November 18, 2015

Time: 6:30 p.m. - 9:00 p.m.

Location: The Loft in Flatiron, 20 West 23rd Street, New York, New York

Featured speakers:

David Hecht, Steptoe

James Aquilina, Design IP
results.name: The Importance of Design Patents

results.description:
In this meeting, we'll discuss material covered in Ch 2 of Causality (2nd Ed.) by Judea Pearl.  

Do read the material before the meeting, but it's okay if you don't understand all of it!  If you get stuck somewhere, make a note of where.  It's likely others got stuck in the same place!  Try to push through and understand as much of the rest of the material as possible.  We'll try to get everyone on the same page at the meeting!

We're an extremely informal group, and the format is generally to put the book up on a screen, and talk through the material.  We stop and discuss sticking points (your notes!) throughout, and dwell on definitions and theorems.

You can also ask any questions about the material in our piazza course page, using the access code stats101 ! -- and it supports latex!  http://piazza.com/nyc_ml_study_group/fall2015/stats101 

Recommended Pre-requisites:

• Probability Theory (intermediate): Know what a joint and conditional distribution is.  Know what marginalizing is.  Understand conditional independence.


• Causality Ch 1.


• Graphical Models (beginner):  Know how to factorize a graph.  Understand what it means for a distribution P to be "Markov relative to" a graph G. Understand what a "Causal Model" is.


• Analysis (intermediate): Be comfortable with product (big Pi) notation, indices, basic methods of proofs, basics of set theory, analysis notation (e.g. the funny e thing for "is an element of")

Logistical Notes:

• Be sure to be on time!  If you're more than 15 minutes late, you may have trouble getting in.  

• The receptionist may be not downstairs with the guest list promptly at 6:00.  If you arrive and the security desk is unaware of the meetup, just hang out until she arrives downstairs to check you in!

• Be sure to bring ID for security!


• There will be signs upstairs ("Math Meetup") directing you to the room.
results.name: Discuss Ch. 2 of Causality

results.description:
DESCRIPTION: This monthly meetup covers algorithms. We'll split attendees into two main groups:

Whiteboarding skills : You'll solve algorithms in small groups, breaking off into your preferred programming language and working together to find a solution. Problems are provided and vary in difficulty, check out the Github for examples of past problems: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Beginners : You'll pair with other members and practice answering easier algo questions. This group will be led by a more experienced developer who will help you out when you get stuck.

Schedule: 
6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code 
7:05 Welcome from Betterment and a short intro talk from Stefania Druga (@stefania_druga) called "Recommender Engines and the Algorithms That Back Them"!
7:15 Meetup starts 
9:30 Event ends after solution presentation from volunteers

Resources: The WWCNYC Github contains questions (and solutions) from past events, as well as upcoming problems! Submit solutions, contribute interview questions and more: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Other resources: 

http://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~kelu/interviews/questions.html
http://katemats.com/interview-questions/
http://meetupresources.herokuapp.com/index.html
http://codingforinterviews.com/practice

Resources for beginners or anyone who needs to review:

http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/algorithms-and-data-structures--cms-20437
http://www.nczonline.net/blog/tag/algorithms/

For our beginners, we recommend creating accounts on either http://jsbin.com/ or http://codepen.io/, to give you an place to practice your algorithms problem-solving skills.

HOST: Betterment is the fastest-growing automated investing service, helping people to better manage, protect, and grow their wealth through smarter technology. The service offers a globally diversified portfolio of ETFs, designed to help provide you with the best possible expected returns for retirement planning, building wealth, and other savings goals. Betterment is a CNBC Disruptor 50 and Webby award winner and has been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, and the Wall Street Journal. Betterment helps people to achieve a smarter financial future with minimal effort and for a fraction of the cost of traditional financial services.

WWCode events are intended for all women (trans and cis), trans men, and genderqueer folks who are interested in attending. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly and committed to matters of social justice as an organization. Select events may be open to the general public, which will be clearly noted in event descriptions. Our Code of Conduct is in effect at all of our events. If you have any questions, please message the Directors of this chapter.
results.name: Algorithms @ Betterment

results.description:
As independent workers, bill collecting often becomes a dreaded but necessary part of work. Clients can be slow to pay and sometimes, never pay. If you’re new to freelancing, you’ll soon experience the "deadbeat client".

During this FSG session, we'll answer the following:

• What do you do to get your client to pay?

• How do you deal with the situation when you're depending on that check to pay your rent?


• How can you be proactive to prevent this from happening?

Let's exchange our challenges & solutions to collectively make our freelance lives a little bit easier.


GUEST SPEAKER

As an added bonus, we've invited Attorney Jesse Strauss to join & share his legal expertise. Jesse is the Founder and CEO of Indepayment, the first debt collection service designed to meet the needs of freelancers & independent workers.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

This group is open to Freelancers, Consultants, Independent Contract Workers, and anyone who wants to transition into self-employment. We will share resources, war-stories, and other personal experiences, in an effort to provide solutions to the many challenges of working independently. Topics of conversation will vary at each meetup.

Topic Examples:

How much should I charge for my services?

How do I deal with a client that won't pay? 

What is the best way to create a portfolio to show my work?

How do I negotiate a contract?

We will try to meet at least once a month. If you have recommendations and/or location requests, let us know and we will try our best to accommodate. If you have any suggestions, ideas, feedback, requests, etc., please share below!

Freelancer Support Group is the brainchild of Lara Schenck, Independent Web Consultant & Educator.

If you have any suggestions, ideas, feedback, requests...please share HERE!
results.name: Freelancer Support Group - How To Deal With A Client Who Won't Pay

results.description:
Guy Lunardi

-on-

Building SteamOS; a Linux gaming OS for the living room

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC HALL!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Wed Nov 4th, 2015, 4:30pm.

With bandwidth consumption exceeding 2 Tbps at peak time, Steam is the force driving video gaming today. Valve, the creator of Steam, has identified that open source offered the opportunity to potentially free itself from strong dependencies on platforms it had no control over -- Microsoft Windows and Apple MacOS. This presentation aims to highlight how Valve leverages and contributes to free and open source software to create SteamOS, a Debian derivative focused on providing a stable and reliable OS for the Steam Client.

We will look at details from hardware enablement, Linux kernel, baseline distribution and all required customizations to produce SteamOS. This presentation will highlight how Debian derivatives can be produced to purpose-built software platforms.


Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at a nearby pub, where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. 

Speaker Bio:
 Guy Lunardi is the VP of business development at Collabora, a consultancy working exclusively on free and Open Source software. Before joining Collabora, Guy was a director of OEM preloads focusing on SUSE Linux Enterprise. Guy has over 20 years of experience helping customers successfully adopt Open Source software. Based in New York, USA, Guy is a native French speaker and is fluent in English. He is involved in the foundations supporting GNOME, GStreamer LibreOffice and Linux.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the far elevator bank to get to the 2nd floor.

results.description:
I may be somewhat partial, however, there’s no place like New York City during the holiday season. During this annual festive period, the streets and shops are buzzing, the iceskating rinks are filled with figure eights, arabesques and camel spins, while onlookers cozy together sipping on hot chocolate or mulled hot apple cider.

At Bryant Park you may witness such events and perhaps even partake in them. The park is set up like a fairytale winter wonderland, with a sparkling tree, a delightful skating rink, beautiful holiday decorations everywhere, and holiday, artist and food vendors in charming kiosks throughout the park -- these do beautifully add to the holiday spirit of the place, you will see (while you are sipping on your hot apple cider with cinnamon stick). 

MOREOVER, AS IF ALL THAT WEREN'T ENOUGH, BRYANT PARK IS -- AMAZINGLY -- A *VEGAN* WONDERLAND. HERE'S WHAT YOU'LL SEE. (AND WHERE YOU WILL EAT!): One 100% Vegan food vendor (Chimney Cakes), right next to another 100% Vegan food vendor (Pickle Me Pete), which is a few feet away from another 100% Vegan food vendor (Marty's V-Burger). Across the way is another 100% Vegan food vendor (Lucky Sailor), which is right next to another 100% Vegan food vendor (Soup for the Soul). Nearby is This Pie is Nuts (delicious 100% Vegan pies from the amazing Diana Cornell). Near This Pie is Nuts is a delightful newcomer: Kaleidoscope - they are 100% Vegan! Across the park is Vegushi -- 100% Vegan sushi! Right next to Vegushi is one of my longtime favorites -- Big Apple Cider: hot apple cider, with or without a cinnamon stick -- I say with! -- which is also of course 100% Vegan!

Then there is 100% Vegan newcomer Super Mac + Cheez, which is right next to Saj Mahal (100% Vegan). And finally, there is the 100% Vegan newcomer Vedge. All together Bryant Park features twelve 100% Vegan food vendors, along with other food vendors that have vegan options!


Is this the future of the world? Yes, it is!! But how did it happen in 2015? Two words: Frank DiPrisco!

Frank DiPrisco is Executive Director, and one of the owners, of the company that organizes the Winter Village at Bryant Park. He is a vegan. And he loves welcoming vegan businesses to Bryant Park!

Frank is my new hero. Over 100 of the the 127 vendors at Bryant Park are 100% vegan. (This also includes vendors who sell merchandise rather than food.)

Frank will actually be leading us on an eating and shopping tour of Bryant Park! He is thrilled and very pleased to be doing this for us. I say: Thank you one million times Frank, for what you are doing to help the animals, for what you are doing to improve New York, and for what you are doing by expanding all of our minds: giving us a glimpse of a vegan future yet to come!

Where To Meet: We will meet at 6:30pm right on the corner of 42nd Street and 6th Ave (the Bryant Park corner of this street intersection). I (David Greene) am 6' 4" will be holding a sign that says "MEETUP". We'll be waiting on the corner till just 6:45pm, so don't be late! At 6:45pm we will enter the park and will be given a vegan eating and shopping tour by Frank DiPrisco, Executive Director of the Winter Village at Bryant Park!


I am so looking forward to this beautiful holiday evening. Come join us.

David

P.S. I am beyond thrilled that our close friend Marty Krutolow, a veg meetup member and a vegan activist, is coming to be a vegan vendor at Bryant Park for the first time this year! Marty has already been enjoying tremendous success with his Marty's Vegan Fast Food featuring Marty's V-Burgers. They are out-of-this-world delicious. Marty, we are all so delighted at your success, and I am looking forward to getting your burgers at Bryant Park all season long!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at 6:30pm on the corner of 42nd Street and 6th Ave (Bryant Park corner), and then all enter the park as a group at 6:45pm. Don't be late or you will miss us!
results.name: Bryant Park Winterland Wonderland - A Vegan Heaven

group.name: The New York City Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup

results.description:
Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must pre pay online)

WHERE: Irish Exit (978 2nd Ave, New York, NY - at 52nd St.)
WHEN: Wednesday, November 18th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
results.name: Social Painting Night: Paint, Drink, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

results.description:
Introduction to CockroachDB, an Open Source, Scalable SQL Database

Presented by Peter Mattis, Co-Founder and VP of Engineering. CockroachDB is a distributed SQL database built on top of a distributed, transactionally consistent KV store. 

This talk will discuss some of the internal details of building an SQL database - comparing PostgreSQL and CockroachDB storage of SQL data, and the challenges of performing schema changes in a distributed system.


+ food/drinks!


Agenda

6:30 pm:  Guest arrival & networking. 

7:00 pm:  Introduction to CockroachDB & Q&A.

8:30 pm:  Event ends. 

About CockroachDB

CockroachDB enables developers to build scalable applications that can survive datacenter-scale outages without breaking a sweat. With strong consistency and transactions, CockroachDB frees developers to focus on what matters, instead of engineering solutions to database shortcomings.
results.name: Introduction to CockroachDB, an Open Source, Scalable SQL Database

results.description:
Actors, Writers, Directors, DP's and Creatives are developing their own shows to take control and call the shots.

Who is this for?

Any creator who wants to learn how to create their own web series, film or documentary.  Any genre and skill level.

This is an information session on how this process can help you get your film made. Also great for those who want to learn filmmaking.

Every month members get together for a pitch meeting. Pitches for films or web series are made, crews are formed and the filmmaking process starts.

It is a simple process. Any member can pitch a film or web series idea that they need help on. In three minutes they express the idea, describe the crew positions they need and get people interested in their project.

Once all the pitches are heard you will have time to mingle with others and talk to the owner about working about their project.

After the information session we will have a pitch meeting for members.
results.name: LEARN HOW ACTORS, WRITERS & DIRECTORS can DEVELOP their OWN SERIES

results.description:
I'm excited to announce designer & BKUX friend Uday Gajendar as our first BKUX x 61Local speaker. This is the first in a series of talks and would love feedback and suggestions for future speakers.


Talk description


You’ve left the safety of a corporate UX team to drive UX for a startup. Congrats! You know you need to make quick impact for credibility and value to the product --and the company! But you’ve inherited a product lacking visual consistency or user-centered workflows... with new features thrown in hastily. Whew! What can be done in 100 days...and beyond for a long-term company UX strategy? I’ll share insights and lessons around the following points:

1) How do we exert design-driven influence?
2) How do we cultivate good habits around design process?
3) How do we deliver a product users will LOVE?

We'll look at a variety of useful steps taken from Day One, such as conducting a UX Audit, tracking UX Debt, building rapport with Sales and Marketing VPs, and advocating user research with design principles.

About Uday


Uday Gajendar is a proven design leader focused on digital product innovation & guiding start-ups on UX fundamentals. Uday has 15 years of versatile expertise at Frogdesign, Citrix, Peel, Netflix, Adobe, CloudPhysics and others, spanning enterprise to consumer, web to mobile domains. He also regularly writes for ACM Interactions and routinely speaks worldwide on design topics at SXSW, UX Australia, IxDA, and other venues. You can read Uday’s thoughts on design at his blog, www.ghostinthepixel.com

<a href="http://www.ghostinthepixel.com"></a>

Transparency Statement from Ian


The cost of this talk is $5, a first for BKUX. The upstairs venue isn't free, so I'm trying to cover cost of the room. Any overage, I am planning on rolling into beer pitchers for attendees.

Also also,


Before and after the talk, we will be hanging out at the bar downstairs... so if you want to hangout with fellow BKUXers and not attend the talk, it can be an unofficial happy hour as well. We will probably not have another BKUX event until January... but we WILL be having a holiday party in the city with all of the other UX/UI/ID/IA/Agile/CS////Meetups & orgs. Details soon!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs
results.name: Leading the Startup UX talk with Uday Gajendar

results.description:
Join us for this class on HTML and CSS aimed at beginners with no or little experience in programming. This class provides a full introduction to the building block of every website, HTML (the content of a site) and CSS (used to style websites including colors and fonts). In this class, you will leave with the ability to create a basic web page and an understanding of the fundamentals of programming. 

Key Takeaways: 

• General overview of programming

• Learn basic techniques and concepts used for website development

• Learn how HTML and CSS work together to create richer online experiences

• Create a basic one-page website with images, content, custom fonts and colors

• We’ll provide you with available resources if you’d like to continue learning

Prerequisites and Preparation: 

• Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook). 

• Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page). 

* Light snacks will be provided.
*This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in our immersive program.
results.name: HTML/CSS For Beginners

results.description:
Event Name: Climb at BKB

Leader: Ed

Event Type: Wall indoor top rope and lead sport Climbing!!

Location: Brooklyn

Climbing Shoes, Harness and belay device are part of group discount $22.00.. Just mention you are part Northeast Hiking at front desk. Also look for us on the wall.

This venue is one of the best indoor rock climbing gyms on the east coast!

The walls range from beginner to expert difficulty, so there is something to climb for everyone. If you have ever wanted to try rock climbing for the first time, or if you're a pro, this is the place to do it! The gym runs 'climbing 101' classes which instruct on how to climb, tie the basic knots, belay fellow climbers, etc. Check out the gym's website.  Why not come out and meet/ climb with fellow members of the group?

http://brooklynboulders.com/brooklyn/
results.name: Wall Climb Indoor / Top Rope and Lead Sport.

results.description:
Calling All Real Estate Investors and Everyone Active in the Real Estate Industry,

Join us for our next live East Coast REIA meeting scheduled for Wednesday, November 18th at 6:30PM.  Our East Coast REIA meetings are focused strictly on pure real estate education and networking.  The word is out and our meetings continue to grow so bring plenty of business cards for networking.  We have anywhere from 60-85 real estate professionals that attend our monthly meetings.  A three course meal is included with your cost of admission.  If you have any questions, please contact our office at[masked]-1563.  Here is what we have planned for this month's meeting:

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Spiritual Laws That Govern Humanity and the Universe by Lonnie C. Edwards, M.D.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 7: Forgiveness and the Indwelling Soul.

You can download the e-book FREE here!

Video on the topic of Forgiveness by Dr. Lonnie Edwards and Julian Johnson.

About the Book

God has created laws by which the universe is governed. Humanity has continued to set these laws into creative motion through thoughts, prayers, motives, intentions, voices, and beliefs. These are the right tools. In this book the student will learn how to use them always for the good.

Human beings are responsible for creating the good, the beautiful, and the true-all of which we desire to experience. But humans are also responsible for creating that which we do not desire to experience. However, being co-creators with God, the quality of our thoughts, beliefs, and intentions will determine and manifest our world. There is work to do, and those who are on the path with knowledge of God’s attributes and God’s laws, and with love and good will in their hearts, will do that work. This is your guide to put these concepts into practice in our troubled world today!

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Spiritual Laws: Forgiveness

results.description:
CASA GRANDE


Coming-of-age as a rude awakening: one high school senior’s dawning sexuality is shadowed by the discovery of his upper-class family’s looming financial ruin. Polished and penetrating, Casa Grande  renders a sharp social canvas of contemporary Brazil through the eyes of young Jean (Thales Cavalcanti), who struggles with newfound knowledge of his racial and class privilege even as his parents, a failed hedge-fund baron and his sheltered wife, grasp at straws merely to survive. An international audience favorite, Casa Grande has stirred lively, searching discussion among Brazilians of the often repressed realities of stubborn racial bias and stark income inequality.

Directed by Fellipe Barbosa, 2014, 115 minutes, Portuguese with English subtitles

Tickets: $12. You can purchase them here  .


Members of the NY Brazilian Portuguese meetup group get a Special Discount. Use code Brazilian Film Series at Box Office when picking up tickets. In case you buy tickets online,  we were asked to purchase the $8 Senior Ticket.


Enjoy the movie,

Aparecida Teixeira

6:45 - 7:15pm  -  Mix and mingle with fellow Product Hunters.


7:15 - 8:30pm - Founders share their experience building and growing their products. Less demos. More lessons learned.

Casey Pugh - Co-Founder / Head of Product of VHX

VHX is a video distribution platform that empowers creators to sell their work from their own websites, directly to their fans. It helps publishers sell films, TV shows, live concert footage, web series and more.  Users can access their VHX Library for on-demand viewing through the web or iOS apps. Casey is the creator of Emmy-Winning StarWarsUncut.com.

Tarikh Korula - Co-Founder / CEO of Katch

Katch is the world's first video platform in a hashtag. It records, archives and publishes livestreams with one tweet using Periscope or Meerkat.  Previously, Tarikh was a resident in the first batch of the NY Times Incubator (TimeSpace) while developing Seen.co.  

Andy Thompson - Co-founder / Director of Product at Cameo (acquired by Vimeo)

Cameo turns your video clips into gorgeous short films in just a few swipes. Users create professional-looking short films with mobile video editing software and an extensive music catalog.  Andy is also a Director of Mobile & TV Apps at Vimeo.

Join us for our monthly business networking group at Rockn' Joe in Union Station. As usual, we will start with open networking from 6 pm to 7 pm followed by a presentation.  This month, our topic is "Overcoming your Fears with your Business and your Life" presented by Frances Camilleri:

As a highly trained, Certified Life Coach and Motivational Speaker, Frances Camilleri brings extensive knowledge and experience in helping her clients discover, design and manifest a life that’s in harmony with their Soul’s purpose and create rich, fulfilling, happy lives.

Frances has her Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Associate’s Degree in Physical Therapy and is an ACE certified Personal Trainer.  She has dedicated over 20 years of her life to personal growth and helping others realize their full potential and create lives they love living.

In enabling her clients to live their dreams, she is fulfilling her own dream because nothing makes her happier than seeing her clients succeed in every area – health, relationships, career and time/money freedom.

“When you’re in harmony and alignment with your True self, when you are living on purpose”, Frances says, “life is easier and so much more fun!”

As a sought after Life Coach, professional speaker, and results expert, Frances offers individual consultations and inspiring, interactive workshops to groups and organizations. Her transformational in-depth coaching programs help clients achieve new heights of success, meaning and aliveness. The techniques Frances applies guide her clients to their unique vision of success.

This event is a hosted by multiple meetup groups. The amount of RSVP's only represents a small number of the amount of people attending.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.

7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

results.description:
Everything, Everything by Nicola Yoon


The Instant #1 New York Times Bestseller

If you love Eleanor and Park, Hazel and Augustus, and Mia and Adam, you’ll love the story of Maddy, a girl who’s literally allergic to the outside world, and Olly, the boy who moves in next door . . . and becomes the greatest risk she’s ever taken. This innovative and heartfelt debut novel unfolds via vignettes, diary entries, illustrations, and more. 

My disease is as rare as it is famous. Basically, I’m allergic to the world.I don’t leave my house, have not left my house in seventeen years. The only people I ever see are my mom and my nurse, Carla.
  But then one day, a moving truck arrives next door. I look out my window, and I see him. He's tall, lean and wearing all black—black T-shirt, black jeans, black sneakers, and a black knit cap that covers his hair completely. He catches me looking and stares at me. I stare right back. His name is Olly.
  Maybe we can’t predict the future, but we can predict some things. For example, I am certainly going to fall in love with Olly. It’s almost certainly going to be a disaster.
results.name: Let's Discuss Everything, Everything by Nicola Yoon!

results.description:
We often hear things like “Take small steps every day and eventually you’ll get there”… but who says you can’t take the right steps and get there now? 

“What you want won’t come easy, but if you work hard and don’t give up you’ll get there”… but who says you have to work hard to get there, and how’s that working out for you by the way?

Another: “Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations”… but who says the road has to be so difficult? 

You do. 

Each of you have created your own road to your goals and dreams, you and only you have chosen the foundation. So, what did you build it from? The belief that before you reach the green light you’ll have to hit countless red ones? The belief that it has to be hard to be worth it, or that things just don't come easy or quickly? Bricks of fear, guilt, shame, and resentment?

If you're now realizing that the road you've built might have a dead-end...         

The good news is you can build a new one. 

The better news is that there's a secret to an “Accelerated Road."

Instead of just knowing the secret, how would you like to experience a transformation with it?

Starting this Wednesday, a FREE workshop will begin where you’ll be guided through exactly how to do that… and more so, live the transformation you’ve been wanting. The material of your "Accelerated Road" is made up of 4 things, each of which build up and support each other. Because of that, each Meetup for the next 4 weeks will build on the previous Meetup, therefore only those who attend this Wednesday, the 18th can participate in the next 3 events. 

The workshop will be every Wednesday evening at 7:00 pm, the schedule as follows: 

11/18 Brick #1: My Financial Foundation 

11/25 Brick #2: Rebuilding Connection 

12/02 Brick #3: The Compass of Your Soul

12/09 Brick #4: Breaking Through to Your Aliveness 

This is a commitment for each week. New members will be able to participate in the next series of this Accelerated Transformation mid-December.

Who is ready for seriously accelerated "inner and outer construction"? From my heart to yours, you now have an open invitation to transform your life faster than you ever thought possible. I only ask, how badly do you want to?

To Our Collective Success and With All My Love, 

Talia 

****Please note: There is a $10 suggested donation to cover the cost of studio rental. Thank you! **
results.name: What Builds Your Accelerated Road? Brick #1 "My Financial Foundation"

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-9:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 39th street between 7th and 8th ave (closer to 8th ave).  Go to 257 West 39th street, and take the elevator to the 14th floor.  And look at the white board for "Steve"

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, November 18th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The November session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (October 27th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

results.description:
Let's walk down the dark & bloody streets of Whitechapel as we uncover the events that led up to the gruesome Jack the Ripper murders & the cover-up that followed. 

// Graphic Novel  
From Hell, Allan Moore  
Legendary comics writer Alan Moore and artist Eddie Campbell have created a gripping, hallucinatory piece of crime fiction about Jack the Ripper. Detailing the events that led up to the Whitechapel murders and the cover-up that followed, From Hell has become a modern masterpiece of crime noir and historical fiction.
(Note: at 572 pages this graphic novel is extra long!)

// Location
The Churchill Tavern, 45 East 28th Street
Join us at this cozy English tavern for traditional fares and a pint! 
Beer $6-$8 / Wine $9-$14 / Cocktails $12-16 / Menu available here. 

// Dues
This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway! (I also accept Venmo.)

Join us next month for Female Superheroes. Vote here for next month's graphic novel.

results.description:
Truth is at best partial, at worst error. We are at best explorers, at worst believers. If we desire to fully grow we must keep exploring. . . Welcome Explorers! (And curious believers too!)

This is a group for exploring and testing each other's new ideas, and for the potential of creating even more together!

As a starting point we'll discuss the possibility of:

A natural morality based on our passion's values;

A politics that roots out resentment so we can enjoy

a unified diversity;

And a culture of 7 billion honest individuals---

with not one truth!

 

This morality, politics, and culture have one goal: That we each flourish--that we each fully bloom into all that we are--together.

 

Can it happen? Should it happen? What do you propose? Let's talk about it!

 

 

Note: Ripple Effect Photo by Segiu Bacioiu.
results.how_to_find_us: 29th St. & Park Avenue, Manhattan
results.name: Is intention meaningful and accident meaningless? Can we find meaning in both?

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.how_to_find_us: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)  1-50 51st Ave, Long Island City, NY
